programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Vale of Berkeley Guest House in Gloucestershire, where owners Harri and Claire Chiba hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, two guests from rival B&Bs have an issue with the no-frills toilet, and another places a tricky request for `anaemic toast' at the breakfast table.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples host dinner parties in Sheffield, with Ray and Chloe, Andrew and Claire, and Rob and Emma all competing for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps mother-of-four Pam in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, whose semi-detached home has been languishing on the market for a year. He also visits David's cottage in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, with dated decor, a bare kitchen and a garden that resembles a jungle. Can Phil make these houses more attractive to buyers?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin help a couple with four children that want to move to the coast to decide between living in Cornwall and Mallorca.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wirth - the CEO of a California ski resort - goes undercover to learn more about his company's working practices as he prepares to merge an existing operation with a new acquisition.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The dinner party competition gets under way in Cardiff, and first to host is primary school teacher Sophie Hunter-Brown. Her choice of a Thai-themed beach party causes confusion among her guests, but cocktails and a limbo competition provide an opportunity for the diners to have fun.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Headmaster Huw Jones hosts the second dinner party in Cardiff, and hopes to impress with a night of fine dining. However, the menu provokes mixed reactions from his guests - Emma Nurse does not like gingerbread or pears, and while Stewart Duff has a fear of mushrooms, Gina Goddard-Bell looks forward to sampling them in a tart.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hosting Cardiff's third dinner party is Emma Nurse, who hopes her quirky food choices and entertainment will serve as a distraction from her lack of cooking skills. The evening begins with salsa dancing and an impersonation game, neither of which pleases all of the guests, and the starter of Brussels sprouts pate also fails to whet their appetites.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gina Goddard-Bell hosts the fourth dinner party in Cardiff, and her guests are apprehensive about the occasion as she has persistently talked about herself at previous dinners. The evening suffers setbacks when she runs out of rice and opts not to prepare her main course in advance - despite apparently taking pride in her organisational skills.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hospitality manager Stewart Duff hosts the fifth and final dinner party in Cardiff, and has a reputation to live up to after constantly talking about his love of five-star cooking and the importance of elegance. Among the dishes on his menu are mixed game pithiviers and garlic ice-cream, and the evening concludes with the winner of the £1,000 prize being announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Nashville, Tennessee, the spiritual home of country music, but his visit begins on a sour note at Chappy's Cajun restaurant. Chef John Chapman's careless methods have damaged his reputation, but he blames the local clientele rather than his less-than-appetising food and disturbing kitchen practices. Can Gordon get through to this stubborn owner and save the eatery from disaster?.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two previous clients helped in their property search by he and Kirstie Allsopp. Professional rugby player Alex and teacher Sarah wanted to relocate from Penarth near Cardiff to west London, only to get a shock when they realised the speed of the capital's property market. Meanwhile, Kirstie assisted Naomi, who was after a place in Hemel Hempstead with enough room for her pole-dancing equipment. How have they both got on since first featuring on the show?.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two young couples who were looking to take their all-important first steps on the property ladder in London. First, Phil meets Cat and Ed, who were searching for a home in the area around Chiswick, before revisiting Ian and Sarah, who were in love with the idea of finding a property in Balham.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: It took 30-year-old Louise and her husband Andy six years to conceive. Now they're looking forward to meeting their baby and showing it off to their worried family and health care assistant Olwen. Cameras also follow Sammy, 23, who is about to have her third child. An undiagnosed condition drove a wedge between Sammy and her mum, when her bad behaviour was put down to teenage hormones, until a long-awaited diagnosis of endometriosis when she was 19 enabled them to build bridges.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Line of Duty, Mary Berry's Easter Feast, Saturday Night Takeaway, University Challenge, Big Little Lies, The Toilet: An Unspoken History, The Dog with an IQ of 102, and the News.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated TV viewers share their critiques of Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs, the final of The Voice, Alone with the In-Laws, Line of Duty, Life Story, One Born Every Minute and the News.(n)

programme.title: My Online Nightmare
programme.desc: New series. This documentary explores some of the most extraordinary scammers and fraudsters who use the internet to lure and con their victims with terrifying, and sometimes deadly, results. This first episode examines astonishing cases of sex fraud, telling the stories of people who were tricked into thinking that the person they met online were someone completely different.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Billy is rushed to St George's after being crushed by falling bricks that were being stored on his front drive, while six-year-old Luther has a metal washer stuck on his finger. Senior healthcare play specialist Tracy talks about her job, which is to comfort and distract children during their treatment in A&E, and 83-year-old Audrey arrives with her grandson Lee after damaging her wrist while falling on holiday.(n)

programme.title: Homeland
programme.desc: Dar scrambles to get his plan back on track, Saul and Keane deal with some fallout from her interview, and Carrie realises that she and Quinn must act fast. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The CEO and chairman of in-store media provider Mood Media, Lorne Abony, goes undercover in one of the fastest growing companies in America. Adopting a disguise in his own business, he finds out how efficiently it is functioning.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Wild
programme.sub-title: Kevin McCloud's Escape to the Wild.
programme.desc: The Grand Designs presenter travels to the foothills of the Andes in Chile to meet a family of five from south London who quit the daily grind to build a new home in the shadow of an active volcano. Kevin arrives at the site on horseback to discover that Jago and Lucy are still in the process of constructing their new home using bags filled with soil and timber from the local forest, which they transport by oxen. He is impressed by the structure, but troubled by one key question. Why choose to live next door to a highly volatile volcano?.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedy actor Jack Dee embark on a clock-conscious exploration of the Italian city, enjoying two days rich in humour, history, culture and pizza. The pair start with a guided tour on vintage Vespas amid the city's chaotic traffic, attend a pizza-making class and then head to the volcanic ruins of Herculaneum. Day two sees them visit the Isle of Capri and play the lottery using la smorfia, a local guide to the meaning of dreams.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Artist Residence in Penzance, Cornwall, where proprietors Justin and Charlie hope to impress their rivals with a pottery class. However, one pair decide their room is too modern for their tastes, a duo are shocked to find hair in a shower filter and one guest seems underwhelmed by breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In north London, recently engaged couple Anita and Cash, laughter-loving Keith and his wife Maz, and foodies Dan and Les compete for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps rescue people stuck in homes they cannot sell, meeting mother-of-four Julie from Billericay, Essex, who never got to grips with her renovation project. Phil discovers a health hazard in the kitchen, a toilet in need of attention and a garden that has driven buyers away, before giving the family tips on how to prepare the house for an open viewing. Plus, in Southend, serial mover June's home is found to be bathed in an overbearing shade of pink.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps recently retired Nick and Jane Purser decide between a move to Lancaster or Marseillan in southern France.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time model and writer Azzi Kalili hosts the first dinner party in west London. She erects a Moroccan marquee in her garden, but seems oblivious to her freezing guests and their dislike of her food.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Plumber Steve Capel hosts the second party in west London, putting together his favourite dish, a roulade of ostrich, kudu and springbok. However, his plans to entertain the other diners with a demonstration of his nunchuk skills are cut abruptly short when an injury sustained in the kitchen comes back to haunt him.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ex-wedding planner and self-confessed perfectionist Zae Greenwood hosts the third dinner party in west London. He tries to impress his guests with a wedding-style menu, but they do not respond well to his culinary efforts.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events organiser Emma Boardman Magliocchetti hosts the penultimate dinner party in west London. She hopes to prove to her new Italian husband that she can be the perfect wife and create an incredible feast, despite never having cooked a three-course meal before.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jane Welch hosts the final dinner party in west London, and has asked her guests to appear in fancy dress. The busy mother is initially nervous about the evening and her adventurous menu, but becomes emotional when her diners compliment the meal. Plus, the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits some of the restaurants that he set out to save, including The Mixing Bowl, The Olde Stone Mill, Peter's and Campania. Have their owners pulled themselves out of their nightmares?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef heads to the Seascape restaurant in the village of Islip on Long Island, New York, in a bid to change the fortunes of its owner, who is nearly $1million in debt. Gordon is dismayed to discover unprotected meat and fish left next to mouldy pesto jars in the kitchen and plans to close down the eatery until radical changes are made.(n)

programme.title: Rome's Sunken Secrets
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the underwater ruins of Baiae, an ancient Roman city located in the modern-day Bay of Naples, which in its time was an exclusive retreat for the wealthiest and most influential of the empire's citizens. A team of historians and volcanologists examine the relics that have been uncovered from the city and investigate the reasons why it sank. Baiae was located in a volcanic landscape, which provided a supply of hot water and steaming sulphur baths - but also led to the city's destruction.(n)

programme.title: Warship
programme.desc: After three weeks at sea, HMS Ocean heads into troubled waters as it passes through the Suez Canal and into an active war zone in the Red Sea off the coast of Yemen, where a US warship was recently targeted. Second-in-command Nick Wood is on his last active deployment and is determined that his new recruits learn how to defend themselves and their ship. En route the ship stops in Alexandria for a spot of diplomacy as the Royal Navy welcomes senior members of the Egyptian military to the ship's aircraft hangar for a cocktail party.(n)

programme.title: Hunting the KGB Killers
programme.desc: The inside story of the murder of Alexander Litvinenko in November 2006 by means of the radioactive poison polonium 210, and of the international manhunt that led to the steps of the Kremlin. The Scotland Yard detectives who led the enquiry and the doctors who fought to save Litvinenko's life reveal the political and diplomatic obstacle course they faced in investigating the murder and tell how their quarries left a toxic trail through the heart of London.(n)

programme.title: The Knowledge: The World's Toughest Taxi Test
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the test that all black cab drivers working in the city of London must take, one of the world's toughest exams - The Knowledge of London. Each candidate must memorise the capital's 25,000 streets, traffic restrictions and ever-changing points of interest, which takes an average of four years of determination to successfully pass.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: An insight into the Mormon community of Rockland Ranch, Utah, where women choose their husbands through an inspiration from God, and men try to prove themselves worthy and wait to be selected. The documentary provides rare access to the residents' rites, rituals and daily lives. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Pets
programme.desc: This episode takes a look at the unique personalities of Britain's pets including a very daring hamster that is caught on camera performing all manner of jumps and stunts, as well as a naughty adolescent puppy sent to training school. Plus, the surprising hidden intelligence of animals as dogs are shown emptying the washing machine, flushing the toilet and even posting a letter for their disabled owners - in many cases providing a line of support they could not do without.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.sub-title: Where in the World Is Abby Lee Miller?.
programme.desc: After the blow-out between Abby, Kira, and Kalani, all three are nowhere to be found. With only five weeks to go until Nationals, each girl has a solo to determine who will get a spot at the National Competition. Meanwhile, Kendall's single is dropping, but without her manager there to promote her, there is minimal fanfare.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: With only four weeks until Nationals, the ALDC is desperate for a group routine win. Meanwhile, the Candy Apples return with a surprise guest. American reality series about the world of competitive dance, following the daily lives of a demanding instructor, her young students and their ambitious mothers.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: The family's antics delay Michael getting to the airport and, when he arrives, the sandwich he spent all day making is scrutinised suspiciously by security guards.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael is determined that Jay's graduation celebrations go without a hitch.(n)

programme.title: Loch Ness
programme.desc: A cynical American scientist is sent to Scotland to prove the Loch Ness monster does not exist, to the outrage of the locals. However, an innkeeper's nine-year-old daughter makes him wonder if there may be some truth to the legend. Family drama, starring Ted Danson, Joely Richardson, Ian Holm, James Frain, Kirsty Graham and Harris Yulin.(n)

programme.desc: A serious injury threatens Paige's dance career. Meanwhile, Maddie lands a dream role and Jill and Kendall shock the troupe when they return.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay Special: Big Family Bust Up.
programme.desc: One-off edition in which the High Court enforcement agents are caught in the crossfire of three bitter family disputes, including a debt-dodging man who pushes his panic-stricken mother over the edge. Plus, a family booted onto the streets at night by a ruthless aunt, and a man who won't engage with the agents and loses his car.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Steph organises an Easter picnic, placing Sonya under additional strain as she tries to put some distance between herself and Mark. Ben opens up to Karl and Susan.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin suggests Phoebe move in with him when she faces eviction, Tori discovers Riley falsified information in one of Nate's medical reports and John agrees to undergo surgery.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Christopher arrives in town on a business trip and brings his girlfriend Sherry with him, which alarms Emily because she had always assumed he would end up with Lorelai.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Lorelai accuses Jess of stealing Rory's bracelet, while Luke finds somewhere new to live - but is shocked to discover who owns the building. Comedy drama, starring Lauren Graham, Milo Ventimiglia and Scott Patterson.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Kevin Stokes and Brian O'Shaughnessy get into a doorstep confrontation with a debtor who wants to prove her family business is bankrupt. However, when tempers flare Brian is assaulted and the agents call the police. Elsewhere, Paul Bohill and Steve Pinner face evicting three properties owned by the same landlord in north London, and Brian and Delroy Anglin collect £2,000 debt owed to a vet in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Sun-kissed Australian soap charting the latest comings and goings of the Summer Bay regulars.(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Date
programme.desc: A single woman is horrified by the thought of attending her sister's wedding alone, a task made all the more daunting by the presence of her ex-fiance. Taking the bull by the horns, she hires a male escort for the occasion - but her decision has unexpected results. Romantic comedy, starring Debra Messing, Jack Davenport, Amy Adams, Dermot Mulroney and Sarah Parish.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

Elsewhere, Stewart and Victor chase £1,000 from a debtor who has defaulted on his payment plan, but they are subjected to abuse and the police are called to a driveway standoff. Plus, two agents try to recover £1,600 worth of goods from the owner of an entertainment company after a wedding day dispute, and in west London, a landlady is owned £9,000 in rent arrears by a young mother.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Benefits Handout
programme.desc: Tony and Diane are experiencing a shift in their relationship when she gets a job for the first time in seven years, Meanwhile, Scott and Leanne's business goes from strength to strength, and single mum Rachel hands out her CVs to local companies in a bid to find work for the first time in 15 years.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on former members of the armed forces. Nigel left the Army in 1997, having served tours in Bosnia and Northern Ireland. He has been struggling to adapt to civilian life ever since and now runs a support group for others in a similar situation. Andrew was a Royal Navy engineer and now lives in Truro, but has had to stop working due to chronic breathing difficulties, and Anthony, who left the Duke of Lancaster regiment after standing on an IED, is now hoping for ground-breaking treatment to help him walk again.(n)

Family comedy based on Ludwig Bemelman's classic children's books, starring Hatty Jones, Frances McDormand and Nigel Hawthorne.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Injuries plague the dance company, and Jill sees a chance for Kendall to shine. Meanwhile, Maddie leaves rehearsals to shoot her guest role on a TV comedy series.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart McCracken and Elmore Victor head to Liverpool for what they expect to be a routine repossession, but instead face the most challenging eviction of their careers. Behind the front door, they find a critically ill two-year-old child with major heart problems, who is on constant life support and unable to breathe without a ventilator. Meanwhile, Brian O'Shaughnessy and Del Anglin chase £2,000 worth of debt owed by a business based in Kent, and recover £4,000 from a recycling business in Buckinghamshire. Plus, Stewart and Elmore encounter another family in crisis in Birmingham, where a retired couple who acted as guarantor for their daughter's tenancy are liable to pay over £3,000 after she defaulted.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: The Rebecchis hear some devastating news that could put their marriage beyond repair. After Xanthe defends Finn against Susan and Elly, she reveals a potentially dangerous secret.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Emily and Lorelai grow closer during a weekend at a health spa. Meanwhile, Rory's plans for a quiet night are ruined by a series of interruptions that reveal more than she could ever have imagined.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Part two of two. On the rebound after a fight with Dean, Rory kisses Tristan at a party. Meanwhile, Lorelai follows her instincts and turns up at Max's house - where she stays the night. Drama, starring Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours

programme.desc: Leah and VJ realise they are struggling to cope and agree to allow Ash and Irene to help with Luc's care, while Kat notifies Alf and Marilyn that John is to face charges of arson.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Cathy learns that Jill and Kendall have gone back to Abby's dance company and vows to get her revenge at the next competition.(n)

programme.title: 100 Per Cent Hotter
programme.desc: The team of fashion experts help transform Kyle, a goth who refuses to wear anything but black, and Jessica, a woman so obsessed with make-up she even puts it on before bed.(n)

programme.title: The Magicians
programme.desc: Julia pushes Quentin to release Niffin Alice, and Eliot agrees to settle the war in Fillory by single combat to the death against the Lorian king.(n)

programme.title: Emerald City
programme.desc: War breaks out in the kingdom of Oz, and as the Wizard prepares to launch an attack on Glinda's army of witches, Dorothy chooses to confront him. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Leap Year
programme.desc: A woman plans to take advantage of an Irish tradition to propose to her boyfriend while on holiday in Dublin. When they become separated, she faces a disastrous journey across the country in the company of a charming local innkeeper, and is tempted to leave her boyfriend for her travelling companion. Romantic comedy, starring Amy Adams, Matthew Goode and Adam Scott.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Just Cause
programme.desc: Mystery thriller in which a Harvard law professor reluctantly gets drawn into the case of a young black man on death row in Florida for the rape and murder of a girl. The lawyer uncovers disturbing facts about the conduct of the police in the case, but just when he seems to have enough evidence to ensure the condemned man's release, events take an unexpected twist(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The first major battle of the Vietnam War in 1965, and the soldiers who were involved, are depicted in this drama(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: Rand Ravich's sci-fi thriller stars Johnny Depp (soon to be seen as J M Barrie in Neverland ) as a Nasa astronaut who loses all contact for two minutes while on a space-walk. Successfully rescued and back on Earth, he gives up his career to join a large corporation, much to the relief of his wife Charlize Theron (soon to be seen in Reindeer Games ). But, as he starts to act more strangely, she begins to wonder what actually happened in those 120 seconds and what this could mean for their unborn child(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home in this nostalgic and moving romance(n)

programme.title: 25th Hour
programme.desc: Brooding crime drama about a New York drug dealer's last day of freedom before beginning a seven-year prison sentence. As he re-evaluates his past and questions how his life led to this point, the young criminal embarks on one last night out with two childhood friends who have avoided lives of crime. Unknown to his trader and teacher friends, however, the final night out is part of a plan with a shocking finale(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Patrick Swayze plays Vida Boheme, a classy and long-reigning drag queen. With his understudy Noxeema Jackson (Wesley Snipes), Vida wins a New York drag stage contest and an all-expenses-paid trip to Hollywood. But when Miss Chi Chi Rodriguez (John Leguizamo) cries at having lost the contest, soft-hearted Vida cashes in the airline tickets so the three of them can take a car out West. The film becomes a strange sort of buddy road movie, with the three cross-dressers traveling across the American heartland in a shiny yellow Cadillac. First they tangle with Sheriff Dollard (Chris Penn). He stops them for a minor traffic violation, puts the moves on Vida, and Vida knocks him out, so they flee. Later, they are stranded by car problems in a small town in Nebraska. Renting a room in a hotel, they put some life into the town and its annual strawberry festival. They provide a mousy local woman, Carol Ann (Stockard Channing), with new role models of assertiveness. They also insist on chivalrous treatment from the local good old boys and give lessons on courting to a teenage girl. This film was released on the heels of the more outrageous Australian film The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, which featured Terence Stamp as a drag queen(n)

programme.title: The Birdcage
programme.desc: A gay couple, Armand and Albert, are challenged to play it straight when Armand's son brings home his fiancée---the daughter of an ultraconservative senator. Robin Williams, Nathan Lane, Gene Hackman, Dianne Wiest, Dan Futterman, Calista Flockhart, Hank Azaria, Christine Baranski, Tom McGowan, Grant Heslov, James Lally, Luca Tommassini, Tim Kelleher, J. Roy Helland(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two longtime friends take stock of their accomplished artistic careers in this meditative drama written and directed by Paolo Sorrentino. Michael Caine stars as Fred Ballinger, a retired composer who, at the behest of his daughter (Rachel Weisz), is on vacation in the Alps with his friend Mick Boyle (Harvey Keitel), a filmmaker currently working on a new project. Fred believes he is enjoying his retirement, but he is soon approached with an offer of a British knighthood if he'll conduct a performance of a famous piece he wrote(n)

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: Dominic Toretto (Vin Diesel) and his tight-knit gang of street racers must battle the brother of a defeated nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists. The film is dedicated to series regular Paul Walker, who died halfway through production(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: The Transporter star Jason Statham takes the wheel in director Paul W.S. Anderson's remake of the Roger Corman classic about a hyper-violent cross-country race that breaks all of the traditional rules of the road. The time is the not-so-distant future, and as America's prisons begin overflowing with violent criminals, the powers that be devise a grisly game that will free up space in the cells and entertain the masses at the same time. Jensen Ames (Statham) is a three-time speedway champion with a dark past. A survival expert and ex-con whose sordid history comes back to haunt him when he is framed for a murder he didn't commit, Ames is forced to choose between donning the metallic mask of a mythical racer known as Frankenstein or languishing away on Terminal Island -- America's most notorious penitentiary. Over the course of the next three days, this unlikely champion will get behind the wheel of a nightmare machine outfitted with machine guns, grenade launchers, and flamethrowers in a desperate attempt to outrun some of the most violent criminals ever imprisoned. Should Ames be the first to cross the checkered flag, he will win his freedom; should he come in second, however, death would be preferable to a grim future in a cramped concrete cell. Co-stars include Joan Allen, Ian McShane, Natalie Martinez, and Tyrese Gibson, who takes over the role of Machine Gun Joe, made famous by Sylvester Stallone in the original(n)

programme.title: The Clearing
programme.desc: Industrialist Wayne is kidnapped by a former employee. While her husband hikes through the woods with his hands bound, wife Eileen reflects on her marriage and their love(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Meg Altman buys an old brownstone apartment fitted with a 'panic room', a secret, state-of-the-art chamber to hide from burglars. She never thought she'd need it, until she heard the glass break downstairs... Stylish, suspense thriller(n)

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: A Scottish warrior fights his way through the centuries on a quest to become the last remaining immortal. His journey takes him from 16th-century Scotland to 20th-century New York City, where the final battle for immortality occurs(n)

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: Set in the early 1970s, this biopic stars Denzel Washington as real-life New York City drug kingpin Frank Lucas, and Russell Crowe as the cop sworn to bring him down(n)

programme.title: Presumed Innocent
programme.desc: Engrossing courtroom drama. Harrison Ford stars as a deputy prosecutor forced to clear his name when he is accused of murdering his lover(n)

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: A retiring safecracker considers one last heist, but his partners may be trickier than any combination he's ever solved. A slick, involving caper(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: In this thrilling fourth installment of the "Jurassic Park" franchise, two young brothers (Ty Simpkins and Nick Robinson) visit their Aunt Claire (Bryce Dallas Howard) who's an executive at Jurassic World, a theme park populated with genetically resurrected dinosaurs. But chaos erupts when a newly created dino escapes its enclosure, forcing the park's animal behaviorist Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) to save the day(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: Rare indeed for a film's two leads to be both nominated for the Best Actor Oscar, but that's what happened to Dustin Hoffman and Jon Voight for their roles as the sickly yet streetwise New York hustler Rico and would-be gigolo Joe Buck, a rube from Texas in John Schlesinger's landmark, Oscar-winning film(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: This action drama puts a new spin on Shaft, one of the key "blaxploitation" films of the 1970s. John Shaft (Samuel L. Jackson), the namesake nephew of the legendary private eye (Richard Roundtree), is a street-smart police detective who with his partner Carmen Velez (Vanessa L. Williams) has been assigned to a racially motivated murder case, in which a black college student was killed in front of a restaurant by Walter Williams Jr. (Christian Bale), the sociopathic son of a New York construction tycoon, who then fled the country rather than face prosecution. Diane Palmieri (Toni Collette), a waitress on a smoke break, saw the murder, but she doesn't want to talk to the police. Two years later, Walter is forced to return to New York, but without Diane's testimony, the city doesn't have much of a case. Soon, Shaft, Walter Junior, and Walter Senior's goons are all looking for Diane, with Junior enlisting the help of Peoples Hernandez (Jeffrey Wright), a small-time drug dealer who will do anything to move into the big leagues. Shaft and Carmen find Diane, but discover that she had a good reason for being on the lam for the past two years. Amidst all this activity, John gets frequent advice from his uncle, with whom he ponders the idea of quitting the force and opening a detective agency. Shaft was directed by John Singleton, from a screenplay by Singleton, Richard Price, and Shane Salerno(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: The Barden Bellas are back, determined to enter (and win) an international competition. After a disasterous performance elsewhere, the Bellas have much more to prove if they want to become the best(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: In his breakthrough Hollywood role Robin Williams stars in Barry Levinson's black comedy as DJ Adrian Cronauer, assigned to the US Armed Services Radio station in Vietnam. His outrageous quip-laden, cynical broadcasting style, matched by his choice of records, immediately lands him in hot water with the top brass; however, his popularity with the soldiers in the field saves his bacon. But as the war comes closer to home and he becomes involved with a Vietnamese girlfriend, he is forced to take both himself and the war a little more seriously(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: In this amusing fish-out-of-water workplace comedy, a 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy start-up fashion company. Later, he unexpectedly becomes a confidant for the overwhelmed young CEO(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a top New York chef, as famous for her organisational skills as for her cuisine, whose life is transformed when a brash sous chef joins her staff and she becomes the guardian of her orphaned niece(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Mild-mannered scientist Bruce Banner has been traveling the globe in search of the antidote that will allow him to break free from his primal alter ego, but both the warmongers who long to exploit him for their own gain and a horrific creature known as The Abomination are determined to stop him from achieving his noble goal in Transporter 2 director Louis Leterrier's take on the classic Marvel Comics superhero tale. For years, Bruce (Edward Norton) has been living in the shadows, pursued by the military and haunted by the rage within. But traveling the world in secrecy isn't easy, and as hard as he tries Bruce can't get Betty Ross (Liv Tyler) off his mind. The daughter of Bruce's nemesis Gen. Thaddeus "Thunderbolt" Ross (William Hurt), Betty represents everything that is beautiful in the world to a man who lives his life on the run. Eventually, Bruce returns to civilization and faces the wrath of The Abomination. While the Hulk may be a formidable force of nature, The Abomination is decidedly more powerful, and determined to destroy Bruce Banner. Created when KGB agent Emil Blonsky (Tim Roth) exposed himself to a higher dose of the same radiation that transformed Bruce into The Hulk, The Abomination is unable to change back into human form and holds Bruce accountable for his frightful condition. With time fast running out for both Bruce and The Hulk, New York City is about to become the ultimate urban battle zone as two of the most powerful creatures ever to walk the earth clash in a massive, no-holds-barred fight to the finish(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Alluring Au Pair.
programme.desc: The body of a Brazilian woman living in New York on a work visa is discovered in Central Park, and when Laura and the team investigate, they discover she had taken a job as an au pair for a young boy with autism - who has now gone missing. The detectives immediately suspect the lad's father, who lost access to his son during a nasty custody battle, but when it emerges that the victim also had a more sordid side-career with an escort agency, a new facet to her murder is revealed. Starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the murder of a model and discover splashes of blood that obviously did not come from the victim, but suggest the culprit is a relative. With Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate when a man on a singles cruise kills two fellow passengers and a suspicious New York governor campaigns to have the villain executed. Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Calleigh's car is run off the road and into a canal while she is en route back to the lab - and although she is unhurt, vital evidence is compromised, jeopardising an investigation into a rogue biker gang. Realising the entire case is at risk, Horatio and the team try to find new leads to solve it. Forensic drama, starring Emily Procter and David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Assistant coroner Palmer is called to the building site on a Navy base where a body has been found. While looking into the incident, he spots an armed man fleeing the scene with the victim's passport and is almost killed as he gives chase. It appears the document was stolen to hinder the investigation, but the discovery of a second corpse reveals a case of stolen identity and a compensation racket.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: Andy is shot when a gunman murders a student at a free concert, but she is saved by her bullet-proof vest and sets out to unravel the motive behind the killing. Meanwhile, Gail has moved in with Chris, and Sam considers moving back to the guns and gangs unit. Canadian police drama, starring Missy Peregrym and Ben Bass.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Crooked Clubber.
programme.desc: The corpse of party goer Zach Shaw is brought in as a suicide case after his body fell from a bridge, but the detectives suspect it was a murder. Comedy drama, with Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An answering machine message leads Briscoe and Curtis to reopen an investigation into an arson attack that killed a girl - but the 15-year-old suspect has a powerful ally in his grandfather, an influential force in political spheres. Award-winning police drama, guest starring Robert Vaughn (Hustle) alongside Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the disappearance of a wealthy couple seemingly snatched from their apartment building, but suspicion eventually falls on a man suffering from mental illness - presenting Ross with a tough ethical decision. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach, Benjamin Bratt and Carey Lowell.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A DNA assessment of a kidnapping crime scene reveals horrifying results for Natalia, who discovers her sister Anya is one of a number of missing women. Racing to track her down, the team finds a collection of photographs that may hold the key to breaking the case. Starring David Caruso, Eva La Rue and Adam Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs revisits his home town to investigate an assault that left one marine dead and another badly injured, and enlists the help of his estranged father to identify the assailant. Suspicion initially falls on a local man whose daughter was dating the survivor of the attack - but later inquiries uncover a tangled tale of uncertain paternity and forbidden love. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine is found murdered in his garage, and inquiries lead the agents to his former sergeant. However, Gibbs and the team soon find out that their man is under FBI witness protection as he is about to testify against a mobster, giving him a cast-iron alibi. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Joe Spano.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo confronts a man impersonating a Navy officer, which results in guns being drawn, and the only eyewitness to the case is the Special Agent's father - who is in town to disclose a secret to his son. The 250th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A controversial comedian must defend both his act and his actions when he is accused of inciting the assault of a protester and raping one of his fans. programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: Voight and Antonio are called to a murder scene to examine the body of a woman who has had one of her ears severed, a calling card trait associated with a known serial rapist in New York. News arrives of another attack - but this time the victim has survived. Meanwhile, Halstead agrees to pose as Lindsay's fiance at a high school reunion, but the couple fail to make it to the event and end up spending an intimate night in a bar. Crossover episode with Law & Order: Special Victims Unit, starring Jason Baghe, Jon Seda, Ice-T and Kelli Giddish.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A government weapons truck is hijacked as part of a plan to allow a dangerous criminal to escape from jail. David Caruso, Emily Procter and Adam Rodriguez star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Investigations into a stolen credit card lead Briscoe and Curtis to a pair of teenage lovers who may have killed their newborn son and disposed of the body. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs discovers a link between the murder of a petty officer and the break-up of his team, leading him and new director Leon Vance to uncover a case of blackmail involving an NCIS agent. programme.desc: The New York homicide detective investigates the murder of Thomas, a young film-maker who did mostly illegal jobs for cash and was obsessed with a 15-year-old cold case.(n)

programme.desc: McCoy and Ross investigate when a restaurant becomes the scene of a shooting, and discover one of the diners is concealing a desire for revenge. programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A marine recruiter is found dead on a civilian shooting range - but there is no blood at the crime scene and evidence suggests he died elsewhere. Crime drama, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.desc: A serial killer begins posting footage of his crimes online - and as the agents investigate, they realise that each film contains visual clues to the identity of the next victim. programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Boobs in Arms. World War II was just heating up, but the U.S. hadn't yet entered the fighting when the Three Stooges made this comic short. It opens with the boys selling greeting cards on the street, none too successfully. One surly guy in particular is a victim of the Stooges' harassment. To get away from his wrath, the boys dash into an apartment building, where they find a weepy young woman who thinks her husband doesn't love her anymore. To help her out, the Stooges offer to try to make her husband jealous. The woman's spouse turns out to be the very same man they harassed a few minutes earlier. To get away from him -- again -- the guys get in what they think is a bread line, but it's really a recruitment line for the Army. In a flash the Stooges are in uniform -- only to discover that their sergeant is the very same angry husband. They manage to make it through basic training and are sleeping through bomb blasts when they're woken up and sent on a mission. The sergeant has been captured and they're supposed to bomb enemy headquarters with laughing gas. Naturally, the gas shell explodes on them and they're captured. At the enemy headquarters, they manage to knock everyone unconscious while laughing uncontrollably. The place is being shelled by the American troops, and the Stooges, still laughing, ride one of the shells as it soars out of the building(n)

programme.title: A Few Good Men
programme.desc: A young and impetuous naval lieutenant and a more experienced woman lieutenant commander are given the job of defending two marines accused of murder. The marines' commanding officer, Colonel Nathan R Jessup, certainly has no intention of making the truth public. Director: Rob Reiner(n)

programme.title: The Lost Boys
programme.desc: In this hit '80s hybrid of the horror movie and the teen flick, a single mom and her two sons become involved with a pack of vampires when they move into an offbeat Northern California town. Lucy (Dianne Wiest) and her sons, Michael (Jason Patric) and Sam (Corey Haim), move to Santa Carla to live with Lucy's lovable but curmudgeonly father (Barnard Hughes). Lucy gets a job from video-store owner Max (Edward Herrmann), then begins dating him, while Sam hangs out with Edward and Alan Frog (Corey Feldman and Jamison Newlander), a pair of vampire-obsessed comic-shop clerks. Soon Michael falls in with some actual vampires after becoming enamored of one of their victims: Star (Jami Gertz), a gypsy-like vixen who is trying to hold on to her humanity even though vampire leader David (Kiefer Sutherland) wants to play Peter Pan to her Wendy. When Michael visits the cavernous hangout of David and his cronies and unwittingly drinks from a wine bottle full of vampiric blood, he becomes an unwilling member of the bloodsucker biker gang. Soon, it's up to Sam and the Frog brothers to destroy David and his ilk without killing Michael and Star. Shot on location in the coastal California town of Santa Cruz and directed by Hollywood pro Joel Schumacher, The Lost Boys became a pop-culture phenomenon thanks to its attractive young stars, offbeat soundtrack, and hip, clever marketing campaign. The film's tagline -- "Sleep all day. Party all night. Never grow old. Never die. It's fun to be a vampire." -- perfectly captured its knowing mixture of attitude and gore. The effects team who transformed Sutherland and company into snarling bloodsuckers would go on to provide equally gruesome effects for Blade, another revisionist vampire flick, more than a decade later(n)

programme.title: Speed

Nastasha Henstridge, Michael Madsen, Marg Helgenberger, Justin Lazard(n)

programme.title: Suicide Kings
programme.desc: Television director Peter O'Fallon made his feature film debut with this independent film that pays obvious homage to the style of Quentin Tarantino, with plenty of violence and funny, talkative hit men. Suave gangster Charlie Barrett (Christopher Walken) meets four young men who have taken over his regular booth at a popular bistro. Charmed by the swaggering kids, he agrees to take a ride with them, but they give him a sedative and he awakens in a deserted mansion, taped to a chair with one of his fingers missing. One of his abductors, Avery (Henry Thomas), says that he has a sister who has been kidnapped and they need two million dollars to get her back, as well as a finger to exchange for her severed digit. Charlie phones his lawyer Marty (Cliff De Young), who calls a henchman, Lono (Denis Leary), who investigates the kidnappings and gives Charlie enough information to start playing each of his inexperienced abductors against the others(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: An Iraq War veteran returns home after a firefight which left him in a coma and took the lives of several civilians. Soon after arriving, he is wracked with guilt and plagued by dreams of a burning man who wants something from him. After being denied treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder, he enlists the help of a psychic to help him understand, and hopefully conquer, his terrifying visions(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Tense thriller about a violent and uncompromising police officer's pursuit of a psychopath who holds the city of San Francisco to ransom. The officer's unorthodox methods do not endear him to his superiors, but the mayor reluctantly agrees that Harry seems to be the right cop for the job. A seminal 1970s law-and-order film that led not only to four sequels but a slew of imitations(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: The second action thriller in the Dirty Harry series sees maverick cop Harry Callahan investigating the slaying of some of the West Coast's most powerful criminals. Dismissing the theory that the murders are the result of underworld squabbling, Callahan learns that each of the victims was killed by a slug from a .357 Magnum - the most powerful handgun in the world, and a weapon widely used within the San Francisco Police Department(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Horror-Thriller in which a young woman who is half-human, half-alien goes on the rampage. programme.title: MacArthur

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Love, treachery, and broken furniture are the hallmarks of this rollicking action drama. Dalton (Patrick Swayze) has a Ph.D., but rather than make a living teaching Socrates at some university, he's opted to become a top-drawer "cooler" -- an expert barroom bouncer who can break up fights without getting himself killed in the process. Dalton is hired to keep the peace at the Double Duce, a rough-and-tumble honky tonk in Jasper, Missouri, where beer-soaked free-for-alls are a nightly event. Dalton is hurt on his first night on the job, and he is patched up by "Doc" Clay (Kelly Lynch), a beautiful woman working as the town's physician. Dalton and Doc immediately hit it off, but Dalton learns that another man, Brad Wesley (Ben Gazzara), already has his eye on her. Wesley is a man used to getting his way; he's an extortionist and crime boss who has nearly everyone in Jasper under his thumb, and he sets out to teach Dalton a lesson, while Dalton is determined to clean up the town like he breaks up brawls at the Double Duce. Sam Elliott plays Dalton's mentor Wade, and Red West, a one-time member of Elvis Presley's "Memphis Mafia," appears as Webster; Canadian blues-rock guitarist Jeff Healey leads the Double Duce house band(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Alone (May 1940 - May 1941). This video is part four in the 26-volume World at War series that chronicles the history of World War II. Originally appearing on television in 1974, the popular programs were hosted by Laurence Olivier. This volume features archival film footage of "Britain's finest hour," when the country beat back the German army in the Battle of Britain. The losses of life and property that the English people suffered were devastating, but the victory was theirs(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Barbarossa (June - December 1941). Acclaimed documentary series telling the story of World War II, narrated by Laurence Olivier. The pact between Germany and the Soviet Union outwears its usefulness, and Hitler turns his tanks and troops against Russia. After a succession of devastating victories, the Germans delay fatally, and the fierce Russian winter takes a grip(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Banzai!: Japan (1931-1942). Laurence Olivier narrates the acclaimed documentary series telling the story of World War II. The Japanese, at war on the Chinese mainland since 1931, hope for quick victories over the British and the Dutch, but 7 December 1941 brings the infamous attack on Pearl Harbor, and the start of an all-conquering sweep through Southeast Asia culminating in the taking of Singapore(n)

programme.title: The World at War

President Roosevelt, however, was committed to aiding the European allies(n)

programme.title: The World at War

The brutal Russian winter and the battle with the Russians and their allies, handed Hitler a major defeat(n)

programme.desc: Lawrence visits a company that fitted a wood-burning stove that was dangerous, while Tommy heads to a football club that has not paid for work done on its pitch.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sonia pushes Bex for the truth and eventually learns that Louise has been involved in the bullying - and while she decides to sort things out at the school, Sharon gives her stepdaughter a reality check about her actions. Former Silent Witness star Emilia Fox, most recently seen trying to solve the mystery of The Missing Crown Jewels in Ant and Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, becomes the latest unsuspecting star to join Dermot and Buster on their Celebrity Tour venture, and Aston Merrygold - whose latest single Show Me was released last month - provides this week's music.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show

Jennifer Hudson provides the music, performing her latest single Remember Me.(n)

Meanwhile, Sharon encourages Louise to apologise to Bex, and Steven makes a suggestion that he hopes will bring him and Lauren closer together. Former Blue singer Lee Ryan joins the cast as barman Woody.(n)

programme.desc: John and Kayleigh are full of high spirits as they head off on their annual works' do. Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Our Friend Victoria
programme.desc: The comedy of Victoria Wood is celebrated by Richard E Grant, with characters including Kimberley's friend, Jim Broadbent's northern playwright and Patricia Routledge's extraordinary monologues as Kitty. With contributions from Julie Walters and Michael Ball, as well as rare behind the scenes photos from her personal archive.(n)

programme.title: Reported Missing
programme.desc: New series. Multiple cameras follow the hunt for missing people across Britain, from the police tasked with finding them, to the family members and loved ones left at home. In this episode, a 12-year-old boy in Darlington goes missing after storming out of a row with his mother, and police search for a missing 13-year-old girl in a rural town in County Durham, who left behind a worrying suicide note.(n)

programme.title: Earth's Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: The last in a set of four documentaries exploring wildlife and plants throughout the year focuses on the spring, when hibernating animals awake and many species search for mates. The programme features footage of grizzly bear cubs, the mating dances of grebes, flowers growing in the desert and swifts embarking on marathon journeys. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: Talking Snooker
programme.desc: Alistair McGowan takes an affectionate look at three of snooker's biggest stars - Alex `Hurricane' Higgins, Jimmy `Whirlwind' White and `the Rocket' Ronnie O'Sullivan. He examines the early TV appearances that captured each of them before they hit the big time, and charts the ups and downs of their respective careers, in an effort to capture a sense of why they were all known as the people's champion.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship

Presented by Hazel Irvine.(n)

programme.desc: New series. Patrick Kielty returns with the quiz show, with Susan Calman, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Tim Vine the famous faces trying to help Becca from Coventry win money.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Rory Reid take a road trip across Cuba in a pair of second-hand sports cars, Matt LeBlanc test drives the Mercedes-AMG GT R supercar, and Ross Noble takes to the track as this week's Star in a Reasonably Fast Car.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham investigates more unusual natural events, including a deep-sea blob spotted in the Gulf of Mexico that mystified oil rig workers and sent the internet into a frenzy. Plus, the washed-up remains of a gargantuan creature that baffled scientists for decades, an octopus whose behaviour was so extraordinary that nobody believed it was real, the curious case of bright blue frogs appearing in pools in Germany and an Australian lake the colour of bubblegum that had an evolutionary secret hidden within its lurid depths.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at the Royal Mansour in Marrakesh, Morocco, which was built by royal decree to showcase the region to world leaders, as well as billionaires and celebrity guests. Monica works with executive housekeeper Laurence, who shows her each of the 350 pairs of curtains must be caressed by hand to create perfect pleats, while Giles dons the uniform of the hotel butlers as he is introduced him to the hotel's underground tunnels, which ensure absolute discretion to the guests.(n)

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: Bruno, a boy in Nazi Germany, moves to the country when his father is placed in charge of a concentration camp. While exploring the woods close to the facility's boundary, he spots a Jewish youngster being held there, and the two become friends - but Bruno remains innocently oblivious to the camp's true purpose. Drama, starring David Thewlis, Asa Butterfield and Jack Scanlon.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: The concluding session on day three in Sheffield, where Marco Fu v Luca Brecel and Mark Allen v Jimmy Robertson were the first-round matches at the Crucible Theatre.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents extended highlights of matches from the first round on the third day of the ranking tournament at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: The Spy in the IRA - Panorama.
programme.desc: The story behind one of Britain's most important spies since the Second World War. Code-named Stakeknife, Freddie Scappaticci worked for the IRA for decades, in charge of rooting out and executing suspected informers - but he was also spying for the British security services. Scappaticci denies the allegations, but is now the subject of a £35million criminal inquiry. Reporter John Ware investigates how Stakeknife operated, why his crimes were ignored and why he has been protected for so long.(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Steph McGovern are in Surrey, where a year ago part-time teacher Flo took some time out to look after the couple's children, aged four, five and six - but her love of socialising means she regularly goes into her overdraft. Meanwhile, her petrolhead husband John has an expensive hobby, buying various spare parts and paying for a second garage. How will the couple feel when some of their favourite products are taken away? Plus, a group of campers test different canopies and Avi Shankar reveals how early children can be influenced by advertising.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team explore weird and wonderful items, and expert Philip Serrell reveals some of the oddities in his own collection, including an unusual desk top object.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence visits a company that fitted a wood-burning stove that was dangerous, while Tommy heads to a football club that has not paid for work done on its pitch.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the full schedule of Easter Monday Super League matches, including Warrington Wolves v Huddersfield Giants and Leigh Centurions v Hull FC.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: St Louis to Jefferson City, Missouri.
programme.desc: New series. Michael Portillo continues his American rail journey west to Jefferson City, Missouri, following the tracks of European settlers in the 19th century. In St Louis he ascends America's monument to the Wild West, the Gateway Arch, the tallest free-standing monument in the US. On the banks of the Missouri River, the political commentator is invited aboard a replica of the original keel boat used for an historic expedition. In Washington, Missouri, Michael tries to craft a corn cob pipe, and in Jefferson City he finds an huge fortified building that served as the gaol for the entire Wild West.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents coverage of the opening session on day four at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring John Higgins v Martin Gould and Liang Wenbo v Stuart Carrington.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces the second session on day four in Sheffield, where the first round continues at the Crucible Theatre with Judd Trump v Rory McLeod and Ding Junhui v Zhou Yuelong. Trump and Ding are aiming to win the title for the first time and both have been runner-up once, with Ding reaching the final last year, only to lose to Mark Selby. The Juddernaut has enjoyed an excellent season that has seen him rise to second in the world rankings, with only Selby above him.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Panellists Angela Rippon, Sally Lindsay and Ed Byrne use their knowledge and debating skills to help contestant Chris from Newcastle win a cash prize. Hosted by Patrick Kielty.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: Red Wing, Minnesota, to Portage, Wisconsin.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his rail journey along the Upper Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota, and the home of Laura Ingalls Wilder, author of Little House on the Prairie. Picking up the Empire Builder rail service he travels to Winona, where he finds out how, in the 19th century, the US Army Corps of Engineers made the Mississippi navigable and how the river is maintained today.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Angus Deayton hosts the third heat, and judges Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden challenge the contestants to make 72 perfectly baked viennoiseries with an added bi-colour element, as well as 72 tantalising cup petits fours. For their Showpiece the teams are given four hours to produce a magnificent under-the-sea themed chocolate creation accompanied by three types of chocolate bon bons, needing to demonstrate a mastery of chocolate, consummate technical ability and artistic flair.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Nature's Wildest Weapons: Horns, Tusks and Antlers: Natural World.
programme.desc: Professor Doug Emlen examines how animals use their bodies as weapons in epic battles to gore, stab, crush and batter their adversaries to death, from elephants to rhinoceros beetles, assessing whether they are more than just instruments of blunt force. For the professor this has been a lifetime's ambition to discover the secrets of nature's arms races, what triggers them and what they can teach us about the most formidable weapons on Earth - our own.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Ed Sheeran performs in three different set-ups, including debuting the Irish band that accompanies him on his hit tune Galway Girl, while cult guitar legend Michael Chapman is on the show for the first time, as he celebrates 50 years of touring. Plus, music by Valerie June, Syd, Dayme Arocena and Marian Hill.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: The concluding session on day four at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where the first round continued with Liang Wenbo v Stuart Carrington and Ali Carter v Graeme Dott.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Timothy Spall: Somewhere at Sea
programme.sub-title: Timothy Spall: All at Sea: Message in a Bottle.
programme.desc: The actor and his wife Shane begin the final part of their journey around Britain on board their barge the Princess Matilda. At Rattray Head in north-east Scotland, they turn right and head south for the first time - but struggle to cope with the inhospitable conditions they encounter as they venture into the North Sea. En route to the English sea border, they visit towns including Peterhead, Stonehaven and Eyemouth, but grow particularly fond of Banff in Aberdeenshire.(n)

programme.title: Inside Chernobyl's Mega Tomb
programme.desc: Documentary following the construction of a 36,000 tonne steel structure to entomb the ruins of the nuclear power plant destroyed in the 1986 disaster. A team of international engineers race to build the new steel structure, but radiation levels make it almost impossible for workers to build right on top of the old reactor. The team face difficult challenges as they attempt to erect this new steel mega-structure and move it into place.(n)

programme.title: Empire of the Tsars: Romanov Russia with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Lucy visits St Petersburg to chart the extraordinary reign of Catherine the Great, whose meteoric rise saw her seize the Russian throne in 1762 and become the most powerful woman in the world, expanding her empire through military victories overseas. The programme also examines the impact of Napoleon's invasion of Russia in 1812, which saw an eventual victory under the leadership of Catherine's grandson Alexander over France, which provided the Romanov dynasty with its finest hour.(n)

programme.title: The Beginning and End of the Universe
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili attempts to discover how the universe will end, with a bang or a whimper? He also encounters a mysterious and enigmatic force that promises to change physics for ever.(n)

programme.title: B Is for Book
programme.desc: Following a group of primary schoolchildren over the course of a year as they learn to read, with some making a flying start as others struggle to learn the alphabet. The film also reveals how much help they receive at home from their parents, some of whom only speak English as a foreign language.(n)

programme.title: Everyday Miracles: The Genius of Sofas, Stockings and Scanners
programme.desc: Professor Mark Miodownik's investigation into the complexities of modern invention concludes with an insight into how new materials enabled people to become curious about the world around them. He reveals the impact the advent of the bicycle had on the national gene pool, and highights how the concept of levitation provided the spiritually inclined to set out in search of their inner self.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: The Ladybird Books Story - The Bugs That Got Britain Reading.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the much-loved children's books, which gained prominence during the 1950s, entertaining and informing youngsters as well as helping generations of pupils to read using their `Key Words' literacy scheme. Narrated by Miles Jupp.(n)

programme.title: Bright Lights, Brilliant Minds: A Tale of Three Cities
programme.desc: Dr James Fox tells the story of Paris in 1928, a time when men and women dreaming of a better life after the First World War arrived in the city. It was also the year artist Salvador Dali and film-maker Luis Bunuel brought their bizarre new vision to the people, and writers and musicians such as Ernest Hemingway and George Gershwin came looking for inspiration.(n)

programme.title: Empire of the Tsars: Romanov Russia with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Lucy visits St Petersburg to chart the extraordinary reign of Catherine the Great, whose meteoric rise saw her seize the Russian throne in 1762 and become the most powerful woman in the world, expanding her empire through military victories overseas. The programme also examines the impact of Napoleon's invasion of Russia in 1812, which saw an eventual victory under the leadership of Catherine's grandson Alexander over France, which provided the Romanov dynasty with its finest hour.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Timothy Spall: Somewhere at Sea
programme.sub-title: Timothy Spall: All at Sea: Stags by the Sea.
programme.desc: The Princess Matilda sails around north-east England, beginning in the coastal town of Amble. Tim and Shane are impressed by Northumberland's historic buildings, including Warkworth Castle and the Church of St Lawrence, and also meet a young sailor circumnavigating Britain in the opposite direction to them. They then head on to Newcastle, where Tim reminisces about starring in Auf Wiedersehen, Pet and meets fellow cast member Melanie Hill. However, their journey hits a stumbling block en route to Whitby, as they receive a reminder of how treacherous the North Sea can be.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.(n)

programme.title: The Big Think
programme.sub-title: How to Live Longer: The Big Think.
programme.desc: Nobel Laureate Sir Paul Nurse examines the moral issues behind extending human life, as methods such as gene editing and stem cell therapies transform the way medicine can conquer disease today. These extreme frontiers of medicine also come with a range of ethical dilemmas, such as when the right time is to try out an experimental technique on a patient and should cells from aborted foetuses be used for medical treatments.(n)

programme.title: Obesity: How Prejudiced Is the NHS
programme.desc: Professor Rachel Batterham, head of the obesity services at University College Hospital, examines the medical cost of obesity that is threatening to bankrupt the NHS. She explores whether there is 'fat prejudice' against obese patients within parts of the service that is stopping them accessing a potentially cost effective surgery, even when recent scientific research supports it.(n)

programme.title: Ray Mears Goes Walkabout
programme.desc: In the second of his trips following in the footsteps of John McDouall Stuart, Ray heads into the Outback with kindred spirit Les Hiddins - also known as `the Bush Tucker Man'. Together, the pair travel to Les's home state of Queensland, where they explore the history of Cape Tribulation, and visit the crash site of fallen Second World War bomber Little Eva - now a monument to the continued work of the Outback rescue services.(n)
