programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs discovers a link between the murder of a petty officer and the break-up of his team, leading him and new director Leon Vance to uncover a case of blackmail involving an NCIS agent. The duo single out three suspects, but learn vital information has been stolen, and realise the whole Persian Gulf Fleet could be in danger.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A lieutenant apparently commits suicide by jumping from an aircraft carrier and Ziva and McGee are dispatched to inform the widow - but arrive to find that she has been killed. Subsequent inquiries reveal that the injuries on her body were inflicted after death and the murder scene was carefully staged to mislead investigators. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs receives a call from his old friend Senator Patrick Kiley, who claims he is being framed for the murder of a naval commander, and seeks help to clear his name. However, incriminating evidence quickly piles up against him - and a second death complicates matters further. Meanwhile, Ziva lets her hair down to obtain fingerprints from a big oil lobbyist. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs revisits his home town to investigate an assault that left one marine dead and another badly injured, and enlists the help of his estranged father to identify the assailant. Suspicion initially falls on a local man whose daughter was dating the survivor of the attack - but later inquiries uncover a tangled tale of uncertain paternity and forbidden love. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine is found murdered in his garage, and inquiries lead the agents to his former sergeant. However, Gibbs and the team soon find out that their man is under FBI witness protection as he is about to testify against a mobster, giving him a cast-iron alibi. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Joe Spano.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A serial killer begins posting footage of his crimes online - and as the agents investigate, they realise that each film contains visual clues to the identity of the next victim. In a further bizarre twist, Abby later finds what seems to be a new video on her computer - and the case takes on fresh urgency with the discovery that it is actually a live feed, suggesting the murderer is somewhere on the premises.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bank at Quantico is robbed and a security guard killed, but the team soon discovers that stealing money may not have been the perpetrators' primary objective. Meanwhile, Gibbs is given the task of evaluating an inexperienced new agent assigned by Vance to help investigate the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rey Valentin.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs sends DiNozzo and Ziva to retrieve top-secret information from a secure military base - a mission aimed at catching a mole in the NCIS ranks. Unfortunately, it soon becomes clear that the traitor is still at large - so the building is locked down and all agents are rounded up in a final effort to catch the culprit. Guest starring Jude Ciccolella.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Having identified the mole in their ranks, the agents arrest the traitor's contact Ted Bankston, a former NSA agent working for a kidnapper code-named the Weatherman - who is making millions on the stock markets out of stolen military data. Drama, guest-starring David Eigenberg, with Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed in what initially seems to be a road-rage incident - until investigations reveal evidence of foul play. Digging deeper, the team finds the dead man belonged to an underground fight club, and sets about discovering whether his involvement was a factor in the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: As Christmas approaches, the team works overtime to solve a robbery - a case made doubly difficult by the fact that the prime suspect is a former petty officer who has supposedly been dead for 17 years. Eventually arrested at a Vietnam memorial, he manages to convince Gibbs of his innocence - but a discovery in the forensics lab suggests he may be guilty after all. Guest starring Peter Coyote.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee is sent to a women's prison to interview a murder suspect, but ends up being captured by the inmates, who have run riot and seized control of a cell block, afraid they will be blamed for killing a guard. Held hostage as a bargaining chip, he tries to identify the real culprit before the warden takes drastic action to resolve the crisis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A naval officer involved in an illegal underground street race is killed when his vehicle explodes. The team's investigations reveal he was carrying classified equipment in relation to his work on a new form of battery that the military had hoped to adopt, and that the explosion - captured on CCTV - is not in accordance with that expected of normal fuel. Meanwhile, Callen latest driving misdemeanour means he must attend traffic school. Chris O'Donnell stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a model whose body has been found near a juvenile detention camp for girls, while Delko and Speedle examine the bizarre case of a man who seemingly burned to death. Crime drama, starring David Caruso, Khandi Alexander and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky is attacked by a knife-wielding woman who accuses him of war crimes, alleging he tortured and killed her brother in Afghanistan in the early 1980s. Gibbs investigates and ascertains what really happened - but has to work with the Afghan embassy to avoid an international incident. Drama, starring David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate the private life of a murdered Navy captain whose actions may have led to his death, while McGee finds his ideal woman on the internet - but it turns out she is too good to be true. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray, Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Inquiries into the death of a marine land the team squarely in the middle of an inner-city gang war - and a message found at the scene of the crime seemingly implicates Gibbs. Forced to confront a secret from his past, he calls his mentor Mike Franks for help. Drama, guest starring Muse Watson and Kari Coleman, with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: One of Tony's old murder investigations is reopened and, in an attempt to find the perpetrator, he decides to switch roles with Gibbs, leading the team in an inquiry that links the case to an embezzlement scheme. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Sasha Alexander, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team heads into the Arizona desert to locate an artist who might be able to help solve the murder of fellow agent Jack Patterson - and discovers one of her paintings holds the key to the mystery. Meanwhile, DiNozzo learns he is in line for an inheritance.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Vance insists on taking charge of an investigation into the fatal shooting of a boxer - but antagonises Gibbs in the process, and finds his own past coming under scrutiny as the case unfolds. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rocky Carroll.(n)

programme.desc: As Gibbs recovers from his gunshot wound, the team is called in to investigate the killing of a US Marine and tries to determine whether the crime is related to an alleged case of blackmail at an illegal nightclub. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.desc: A former US Navy Seal escapes from prison, intent on finding his wife's real murderer. The break-out sparks a race against time as the NCIS team tries to reach him before he exacts revenge. Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Sasha Alexander star.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts as contestants from the world of comedy take part in the game show. They are Birds of a Feather actresses Lesley Joseph and Linda Robson, impressionists Ronni Ancona and Phil Cornwell, Hi-de-Hi! stars Su Pollard and Ruth Madoc and stand-up comics Josh Widdicombe and Sara Pascoe. Who'll be best when it comes to picking the most obscure correct responses? Richard Osman is the one with the answers.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert asks Ray and Debra to help with his criminal psychology course by taking IQ tests - but gives them misleading results to gauge their reactions.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard returns from his space mission, but the welcome from his friends and family does not meet his expectations. His night alone with Bernadette goes badly, his mother ignores him, and he realises Stuart has taken his place as Raj's best friend. On top of that, Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny kick him out of their group games night. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Stuart hosts a Halloween party at the comic-book store, and Howard talks incessantly about his work on board the International Space Station, annoying his wife and friends. Penny and Leonard have a steamy encounter at the lab. Guest starring real-life astronaut Buzz Aldrin.(n)

programme.title: Postman Pat: The Movie
programme.desc: The small-town postman enters a TV talent contest, and is soon tempted away from his simple life by the bright lights of celebrity. Meanwhile, a sinister corporation has plans for taking over his deliveries. Animated adventure, with the voices of Stephen Mangan, Rupert Grint, Jim Broadbent and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: We're Going on a Bear Hunt
programme.desc: Animated adventure, based on the popular children's bedtime book of the same name, by Michael Rosen. Stan, Katie, Rosie, Max and the baby, along with Rufus the dog, all embark on a quest to find some bears. Trekking through whirling snowstorms, muddy bogs and dark forests, the siblings refuse to let anything get in their way. However, when Rosie and Rufus end up getting lost, bear-hunting suddenly doesn't seem quite so much fun after all. Jimmy Doherty looks into the reasons why so many consumers are avoiding gluten, and Matt Tebbutt finds out which part of the pig goes into chewy sweets.(n)

Second-in-command Nick Wood is on his last active deployment and is determined that his new recruits learn how to defend themselves and their ship. En route the ship stops in Alexandria for a spot of diplomacy as the Royal Navy welcomes senior members of the Egyptian military to the ship's aircraft hangar for a cocktail party.(n)

The Scotland Yard detectives who led the enquiry and the doctors who fought to save Litvinenko's life reveal the political and diplomatic obstacle course they faced in investigating the murder and tell how their quarries left a toxic trail through the heart of London.(n)

programme.title: Elizabeth II: Crown and Country
programme.desc: Documentary looking back at the Queen's reign, from her ascension to the throne in 1952, following the death of her father George VI, to her Diamond Jubilee celebrations. This updated version celebrates her becoming Britain's longest reigning monarch, and archive footage and interviews help tell the story of a monarch who has steered the royal family into a new millennium and beyond. She has overseen Britain's transformation into a multicultural nation, travelled farther than any other Queen in history, and shared the world stage with countless historic figures along the way.(n)

programme.title: Inside Buckingham Palace: The Queen's Worst Year
programme.desc: An in-depth look at the events of 1992, the year Her Majesty famously dubbed her `annus horribilis' in a speech delivered at London's Guildhall to mark the other anniversary of her Accession. It was a year that saw a fire ravage Windsor Castle, the marriages of Anne, Andrew and Charles collapse, Sarah Ferguson appear topless in the newspapers apparently having her toes sucked by her boyfriend, and Andrew Morton's revelations about Diana made public in a best-selling book. Featuring expert analysis from assorted contributors.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Tube: Going Underground
programme.desc: Rob Bell examines how London's overcrowding problem was the issue that prompted the building of the world's first underground railway, which linked Paddington and a terminus at Farringdon and went into operation in January 1863. Rob lives out a boyhood dream of riding on one of the original steam trains that carried passengers through tunnels, and learns how unpleasant it must have been.(n)

programme.title: All New Traffic Cops

programme.desc: A murder suspect is pursued and trapped in Bradford by a task force of traffic cops and officers from a homicide unit. programme.desc: Host Rufus Hound and his guests go in search of the top car for rural living. Naturalist Nick Baker test drives the first Land Rover ever made to get a better idea of its legendary status. The vehicle became an icon of British motoring, despite having its roots in America. Plus, Tim Shaw suggests the Triumph Spitfire as ideal for summery country lanes and John Burton extols the virtues of the roomy Jaguar Mk 2. Rufus also considers the Ford Granada. programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Manchester's Strangeways is one of the largest high security prisons in the country. For nearly 150 years this building has imprisoned some of the UK's most dangerous criminals. Here cameras look behind the bars to tell the stories of gang culture, penal punishment and the biggest prison riot in British history which led to the major prison reforms in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Psychopaths
programme.desc: Forensic psychiatrist Professor Tony Maden focuses on what makes psychopaths different from the rest of the population and examines the case of Mick Philpott, whose arson attack on his family home in Derby in May 2012 resulted in the death of six of his children. He also explores how psychopathic personality traits can be socially valuable, with surgeon Gabriel Weston admitting to being able to turn off emotions during work.(n)

programme.title: Fritzl: What Happened Next
programme.desc: The case of the Austrian man who kept his daughter prisoner for 24 years in the cellar of his house, until she was released in 2008 at the age of 42. Dramatically pleading guilty to all of the charges at the last moment of the trial, he was sentenced to life in a secure unit for incest, imprisonment, raping the victim - who bore seven children - and causing the death of one child by neglect. This documentary explores the crime itself, Fritzl's trial and the aftermath for everyone involved, and ponders how anyone can possibly recover from such an ordeal.(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer stars as John Holmes, legendary porn star of huge talent but who, in the 80s, was out of films and into drugs. He falls in with gangster Eddie Nash (Eric Bogosian) who believes Holmes told a bunch of drugs dealers about his wealth and robbed him. Four are found beaten to death, the survivor incriminates Holmes but at trial, he's acquitted, although ex-wife Lisa Kudrow isn't so sure. James Cox's film, told in different time frames and almost from a Rashomon point of view, is a glimpse of the Los Angeles nightmare, where not everybody is a tooth-whitened Hollywood star(n)

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: As production gets under way on yet another sequel to the film Stab, the gruesome killings begin once again, with Sidney (Neve Campbell) visiting Hollywood when pictures of her mother provide a clue to the deaths(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Joe Darrow works as a doctor in the emergency room of Chicago Memorial Hospital. His wife, Emily Darrow, was last seen in a rainstorm in Venezuela, where she was on a retreat with the Red Cross offering humanitarian aid. She vanished in a bus accident. There were no survivors and her body was never found. That rich, green, exotic land is left behind as Joe is challenged to persevere through sad, rainy days back home. Joe promised Emily that if anything ever happened to her, he would visit her patients in the oncology ward. Strangely, the children seem to know him, and they say they've seen Emily in their near-death experiences. Joe starts to believe that his wife is using the near-death experiences of her terminal patients to communicate with him, through images the children report seeing in their dreams, and symbols they are inexplicably compelled to draw. While the children see Joe as a kindred spirit, the hospital staff worries about how these interactions are agitating them. At home, Joe begins finding other ethereal evidence of his wife's attempt to contact him from beyond the grave, some of it featuring the image of a dragonfly, which was the shape of the birthmark on her shoulder. His friends and a caring neighbor (Kathy Bates) worry that Joe is losing his marbles, especially as his quest becomes more frantic, putting his job in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: Quick Change
programme.desc: Bill Murray stars in this comedy about three thieves who find robbing a New York City bank easy, but escaping the city to be almost impossible!(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: The self-styled sexiest spy in the world travels back to the 1960s after his nemesis steals his most treasured possession: his 'mojo'. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In this galvanizing feminist drama, a working-class laundress (Carey Mulligan) in 19th century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women organizing to obtain the vote(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: This drama is based on Laurel Hester a New Jersey police lieutenant (Julianne Moore) and her domestic partner Stacie Andree (Ellen Page) who battle to have pension benefits from Hester pass on to her partner after she is diagnosed with terminal lung cancer. Directed by Peter Sollett. Also stars Steve Carell, Michael Shannon, Josh Charles, Luke Grimes, Mary Birdsong and Gabriel Luna(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: Following a brutal bank robbery, the bank owner and his clients became FBI's prime suspects. However, further investigations into the series of heists uncover a deeper conspiracy(n)

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: A dimwitted criminal kidnaps a baby that belongs to a wealthy local businessman in order to make his depressed wife who is unable to have children of her own happy. Soon he finds himself on the run from the police, old criminal pals, and a mysterious motorcycle-riding madman(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must re-evaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: Retired male stripper Magic Mike (Channing Tatum) decides to help his friends put on one last show, as the crew embark on a road trip to Myrtle Beach to perform at an exotic-dance convention. Along the way, they brighten the lives of several women, including an aspiring photographer (Amber Heard) and a diva (Jada Pinkett Smith) from Mike's past(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A professional thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: Eulogy
programme.desc: Writer/director Michael Clancy makes his feature film debut with the black comedy Eulogy. Zooey Deschanel plays Kate Collins, an unhappy college student who is made even more unhappy when her grandfather (Rip Torn) dies. Even though the entire family hates each other, they reunite at the home of Grandma Collins (Piper Laurie). Among other family members, Kate observes a war between her washed-up actor dad, Daniel (Hank Azaria); her lesbian Aunt Lucy (Kelly Preston); her wound-up Uncle Skip (Ray Romano); and her strict Aunt Alice (Debra Winger). Tensions escalate and family secrets are ultimately revealed. Kate is also inundated with the eulogy-writing duties, as she's the only one capable of such a task. Meanwhile, she reunites with old flame Ryan Carmichael (Jesse Bradford). Eulogy premiered at the Sundance Film Festival in 2004(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: World Wrestling Entertainment superstar Kane gives a killer performance as a deranged, hulking psychopath who terrorizes eight teens working to rehab a decrepit hotel. It's no-holds-barred mayhem as the murderer employs a variety of different weapons and instruments to dispatch his victims. Directed by Gregory Dark. WWE head Vince McMahon serves as executive producer. Steven Vidler, Christina Vidal, Michael J. Pagan, Samantha Noble, Cecily Polson, Luke Pegler, Penny McNamee, Craig Horner(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Comedy about a failed actor turned drama teacher who, in a final and deluded attempt to make an impact, sets about creating a controversial and 'inspirational' sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: A gripping drama based on the true story of the mission to rescue 33 miners who were trapped in a underground mine for 69 days(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: The Transporter star Jason Statham takes the wheel in director Paul W.S. Anderson's remake of the Roger Corman classic about a hyper-violent cross-country race that breaks all of the traditional rules of the road. The time is the not-so-distant future, and as America's prisons begin overflowing with violent criminals, the powers that be devise a grisly game that will free up space in the cells and entertain the masses at the same time. Jensen Ames (Statham) is a three-time speedway champion with a dark past. A survival expert and ex-con whose sordid history comes back to haunt him when he is framed for a murder he didn't commit, Ames is forced to choose between donning the metallic mask of a mythical racer known as Frankenstein or languishing away on Terminal Island -- America's most notorious penitentiary. Over the course of the next three days, this unlikely champion will get behind the wheel of a nightmare machine outfitted with machine guns, grenade launchers, and flamethrowers in a desperate attempt to outrun some of the most violent criminals ever imprisoned. Should Ames be the first to cross the checkered flag, he will win his freedom; should he come in second, however, death would be preferable to a grim future in a cramped concrete cell. Co-stars include Joan Allen, Ian McShane, Natalie Martinez, and Tyrese Gibson, who takes over the role of Machine Gun Joe, made famous by Sylvester Stallone in the original(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A young couple are terrorized by three masked intruders at a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: The creation of one of the most memorable books of the 1960s -- and the impact the writing and research would have on its author -- is explored in this drama based on a true story. In 1959, Truman Capote (played by Philip Seymour Hoffman) was a critically acclaimed novelist who had earned a small degree of celebrity for his work when he read a short newspaper item about a multiple murder in a small Kansas town. For some reason, the story fascinated Capote, and he asked William Shawn (Bob Balaban), his editor at The New Yorker, to let him write a piece about the case. Capote had long believed that in the right hands, a true story could be molded into a tale as compelling as any fiction, and he believed this event, in which the brutal and unimaginable was visited upon a community where it was least expected, could be just the right material. Capote traveled to Kansas with his close friend Harper Lee (Catherine Keener), herself becoming a major literary figure with the success of To Kill a Mockingbird, and while Capote's effete and mannered personal style stuck out like a sore thumb in Kansas, in time he gained the trust of Alvin Dewey (Chris Cooper), the Kansas Bureau of Investigation agent investigating the murder of the Clutter family, and with his help Capote's magazine piece grew into a full-length book. Capote also became familiar with the petty criminals who killed the Clutter family, Dick Hickock (Mark Pellegrino) and Perry Smith (Clifton Collins Jr.), and in Smith he found a troubling kindred spirit more like himself than he wanted to admit. After attaining a sort of friendship with Smith under the assumption that the man would be executed before the book was ever published, Capote finds himself forced to directly confront the moral implications of his actions with regards to both his role in the man's death, and the way that he would be remembered. Capote also co-stars Bruce Greenwood as Capote's longtime companion Jack Dunphy, and Amy Ryan as Mary Dewey, Alvin's wife who became a confidante of Capote's(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Epic romantic adventure, set just prior to WWII, about an English aristocrat and the rugged drover who helps her with the cattle ranch she inherited(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Comedy about a failed actor turned drama teacher who, in a final and deluded attempt to make an impact, sets about creating a controversial and 'inspirational' sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: Two decades after being kicked out of a famous heavy-metal group, a failed fortysomething drummer gets a second chance to rock when he joins his teen nephew's band. Rainn Wilson ("The Office") stars in this hilarious, feel-good comedy from Peter Cattaneo, the director of "The Full Monty." Christina Applegate, Josh Gad, Teddy Geiger, Emma Stone(n)

programme.title: Paper Towns
programme.desc: A nerdy teen falls for the enigmatic girl next door, who vanishes after the two have an adventure together one night. She leaves behind a trail of clues, which lead him and his pals to go on a road trip to find her(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: This action drama puts a new spin on Shaft, one of the key "blaxploitation" films of the 1970s. John Shaft (Samuel L. Jackson), the namesake nephew of the legendary private eye (Richard Roundtree), is a street-smart police detective who with his partner Carmen Velez (Vanessa L. Williams) has been assigned to a racially motivated murder case, in which a black college student was killed in front of a restaurant by Walter Williams Jr. (Christian Bale), the sociopathic son of a New York construction tycoon, who then fled the country rather than face prosecution. Diane Palmieri (Toni Collette), a waitress on a smoke break, saw the murder, but she doesn't want to talk to the police. Two years later, Walter is forced to return to New York, but without Diane's testimony, the city doesn't have much of a case. Soon, Shaft, Walter Junior, and Walter Senior's goons are all looking for Diane, with Junior enlisting the help of Peoples Hernandez (Jeffrey Wright), a small-time drug dealer who will do anything to move into the big leagues. Shaft and Carmen find Diane, but discover that she had a good reason for being on the lam for the past two years. Amidst all this activity, John gets frequent advice from his uncle, with whom he ponders the idea of quitting the force and opening a detective agency. Shaft was directed by John Singleton, from a screenplay by Singleton, Richard Price, and Shane Salerno(n)

programme.desc: The Passion of the Jew. After Cartman tells Kyle that he is scared of learning the truth about the Jews, Kyle decides to go and see 'The Passion of Christ'. Series 8, Episode 3(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Go God Go I & XII. Cartman attempts time travel so he can play a soon-to-be-released video-game system; and later tries to escape a dystopian future plagued by militant otters and a lack of video games(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.sub-title: Osama bin Laden Has Farty Pants
programme.desc: Osama bin Laden Has Farty Pants. Who needs Special Ops when you have Cartman's fat ass on your side? Go America! Go Broncos!(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The Tooth Fairy's Tats 2000. Cartman impersonates the Tooth Fairy when he learns there's money to be made from harvesting the teeth of underprivileged kids. However, the leader of a dentists' organization sets out to stop him(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: That Wrestling Show. After Red and Bob join the gang at a wrestling match, Red tries to bond with Eric, while Bob frets about Midge's group therapy, wondering where he's gone wrong(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The First Date. On Valentine's Day, Eric and Donna have their first official date, a fancy dinner that includes an appearance by Hyde. Meanwhile, Kelso seeks another "proof of love" with Jackie (Mila Kunis). Donna: Laura Prepon(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The Pill. Jackie (Mila Kunis) thinks she's pregnant; Eric (Topher Grace), who had nothing to do with it, is the first to find out, and Kelso (Ashton Kutcher), who probably had everything to do with it, goes into a panic. Madge (Tanya Roberts) immediately respond to the news by putting Donna (Laura Prepon) on the pill -- but Donna's dad, Bob (Don Stark), isn't informed of this until the most inopportune (and most embarrassing) moment. But fear not: everything ends happily...at least almost everything. One Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In announcer Gary Owens has a hilarious cameo role(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Career Day. Eric makes a new friend after sharing interest in his new friends car. Kelso and Hyde are upset when Eric spends more time with the new guy than them(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: Arnie Schwarzenegger's 50 Greatest Ever Stunts
programme.desc: Actor and former Governor of California Arnold Schwarzenegger presents a countdown of the most spectacular stunts ever committed to film. The Terminator star famously insisted on performing many of his own stunts during his Hollywood action-man heyday, and here, he highlights the achievements of fellow stars whose efforts produced thrilling set-pieces on-screen. However, Arnie does not limit himself to high-octane antics from the silver screen. He also showcases stand-alone feats, such as Jean Claude Van Damme's daring splits manoeuvre between two moving trucks, and Felix Baumgartner's free fall to Earth from the stratosphere. Includes commentary from fans, comedians, stunt coordinators and the daredevils themselves.(n)

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May visit Africa on a mission to find the definitive source of the Nile, the world's longest river, which spans more than 4,000 miles. The trio believe they can do a better job than explorers who claim to have discovered the waterway's starting point by travelling further and faster than previous efforts - but the only tools at their disposal are determination, ingenuity and three ageing estate cars.(n)

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May head to New Zealand to take part in a race along the coastline to the tip of the North Island - with one behind the wheel of a car and the other in an America's Cup yacht. Back in the UK, Richard Hammond tries out three hot hatches as he puts the Renaultsport Clio 200, Peugeot 208 GTi and Ford Fiesta ST through their paces, and a host of stars including Warwick Davis, Charles Dance and Joss Stone assemble at the test track to welcome a new Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of £35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around £2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three used V8-engined sports cars on a gruelling road South American trip covering 1,600 miles through Patagonia. Their chosen vehicles are the Porsche 928, Lotus Esprit and Ford Mustang, which are subjected to rigours beyond the scope of their original designs - from tackling swamps and crossing deserts to navigating forests, beaches and ski slopes. Their destination is Ushuaia, the world's southernmost city, where they hope to stage a game of car football against Argentina.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A rare disease spreads around Poplar Street, and Patsy and Dr Turner try to trace the outbreak to its source. Suspicion over the identity of the first carrier threatens to divide a previously close-knit family. Sister Winifred is forced to confront her prejudices while treating a patient, and Barbara worries about how Trixie will react when she agrees to go to dinner with Tom.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne is seconded to a maternity ward, and is impressed by how modern technology is being used to help the mothers - but is left with a moral dilemma after assisting on a traumatic birth. A young man from Poplar is delighted to be accepted into university, but his mother is less than happy. His dreams are jeopardised when his girlfriend gets pregnant, a development that puts pressure on the whole family.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner and Shelagh are at the forefront of the advances in medical technology, and begin a campaign to ensure better respiratory health for their patients. However, Timothy fears their own lifestyle is not good for them and tries to encourage his parents to give up smoking. Violet injures her back and is forced to leave the shop in Fred's hands, a decision that strengthens their relationship but which proves to have other, unforeseen consequences. A new mother's past comes to light, with devastating repercussions for her family. Nurse Crane draws on her own experiences to help her.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is rocked by a series of violent attacks on women, and a prostitute is too ashamed to report what she knows - but her actions lead to a dangerous man roaming the streets, with devastating consequences for the residents of Nonnatus House. A mother tries to keep her daughter's pregnancy a secret to avoid gossip, putting her life in danger. The Turners go on a long overdue holiday, but the weather ruins their plans.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The introduction of the contraceptive pill is welcomed by Dr Turner, but some of his colleagues are less keen on the idea. Patsy tries to help a bargee who wants to give birth among her own community rather than in a maternity ward. Nurse Crane deals with an emergency during a storm, and a familiar face returns to Nonnatus House - but has been changed by her time away.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is horrified to realise he may be partly to blame as the cause of the recent rise in birth deformities comes to light, and tries to prevent further cases. Sister Evangelina returns to work, but has clearly been affected badly by her stroke, and her health continues to deteriorate. A pregnant bride goes into labour during her wedding reception, while her mother is forced to come to terms with her grandchild being conceived out of wedlock.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: It's Christmas time in Poplar and love is in the air as Jenny's relationship with Alec continues to blossom, while Shelagh is planning her quiet wedding to Dr Turner. However, the peace is suddenly disturbed when the police arrive at Nonnatus House to announce an unexploded bomb has been discovered just around the corner and everybody in the district is being evacuated to safety. The electricity has been cut off and the streets are pitch-black, and with the locals scurrying to safety, the nuns and nurses reach out to anyone in need of medical help. The spirit of the Blitz takes over as the community's members pull together - aware that, at any moment, their homes could be reduced to rubble. Jessica Raine, Jenny Agutter, Pam Ferris and Laura Main star in a festive special of the 1950s-set drama, with a guest appearance by comedian Sandi Toksvig.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking.(n)

programme.title: A Bear Named Winnie
programme.desc: A Canadian soldier travelling to fight in the First World War finds an orphaned bear cub in Ontario. After adopting the young animal, he ultimately donates it to London Zoo, where it provides the inspiration for AA Milne's Winnie the Pooh stories. Fact-based drama, with Michael Fassbender, Gil Bellows and David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: Miss Lucia decides to take Tilling's cultural welfare in hand by beginning a series of musical evenings, although Mapp is curious to notice the odd moan from the locals - could they be tiring of her high-handed ways? Mapp is keen to encourage a revolt, convinced her rival is a fraud since learning she traced her sketch for the art exhibition. Now all she needs is a way to show her up once and for all. Meanwhile, Miss Mapp and Diva are engaged in their own skirmish, this time over the season's latest fashions, and the rest of the townsfolk are trying to quell their excitement as news arrives that the Prince of Wales is to pass through the station. Period comedy, starring Miranda Richardson, Anna Chancellor, Steve Pemberton and Frances Barber. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.sub-title: The Clue of the Savant's Thumb.
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the quirky crime drama. A dead body impossibly vanishes from a locked study - giving self-styled paranormal investigator Joey Ross a fresh mystery to solve. She could do with some help from her old sidekick, the master of illusion Jonathan Creek - but he has moved on and shows little interest in the case. As Joey starts digging she meets the investigating officer - Gideon Pryke, a sharp-minded DI who remembers Creek from one of his previous cases. But he's not quite the man he used to be. Alan Davies stars, with Sheridan Smith, Rik Mayall, Joanna Lumley and Nigel Planer.(n)

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a doorkeeper at the House of Lords is murdered, Lynley and Havers believe the victim's gambling debts must have been the motive. When a clerk also dies, evidence of a wider conspiracy involving stolen papers is uncovered. The detectives locate the missing documents, but realise they are being followed and must catch the killer before someone beats them to it.(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: Miss Lucia decides to take Tilling's cultural welfare in hand by beginning a series of musical evenings, although Mapp is curious to notice the odd moan from the locals - could they be tiring of her high-handed ways? Meanwhile, Miss Mapp and Diva are engaged in their own skirmish, this time over the season's latest fashions, and the rest of the townsfolk are trying to quell their excitement as news arrives that the Prince of Wales is to pass through the station. programme.title: Upstairs Downstairs
programme.sub-title: A Faraway Country About Which We Know Nothing.
programme.desc: Drama and intrigue with the aristocrats and serving staff of 165 Eaton Place as it opens its doors once more. September 1938, and as dark clouds gather over Europe, Hallam's preoccupation with Nazi Germany leads him into dangerous waters overseas. Back home, Lady Agnes is frail following the birth of her second child, and finds great support in the forthright Aunt Blanche, who has made herself comfortable at Eaton Place following the funeral of her sister Lady Holland. In the servants' quarters, Rose is taken ill with TB, so the staff welcome spirited new maid Beryl, who catches Harry's eye, while events upstairs end in a startling revelation about Mr Pritchard. Keeley Hawes, Ed Stoppard, Alex Kingston and Adrian Scarborough star.(n)

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: Two weeks' military leave is all it takes for US Army Staff Sergeant John Tyree and college student Savannah Curtis to fall in love in this Lasse Hallström-directed adaptation of Nicholas Sparks' novel. Having depended on letters to keep their romance alive, their relationship falters when John unexpectedly decides to re-enlist in the army following the September 11 attacks in New York. Then it arrives - the Dear John letter informing him that Savannah is engaged to someone else. With no hope of being together, John rededicates himself to the military, surviving injury and only seeing Savannah when family events force him to return home. Months later, John receives another letter from Savannah with their sign-off of old, 'I'll see you soon, then'. Could there be hope for the couple yet? Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.desc: The Real Me. programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Defining Moments. While out on the town one night with Big (Chris Noth), Carrie (Sarah Jessica Parker) finds their new status as "friends" being tested when she is hit on by Ray King (Craig Bierko), a slick jazz musician. Big makes his displeasure with Carrie's flirtation blatantly obvious, leading Carrie to realize that they need to define the grayer aspects of their evolving relationship. Speaking of relationships, Samantha (Kim Cattrall) finds herself attracted to Maria (Sonia Braga), a Brazilian artist who defines herself as a "relationship person" and would like to embark on one with Samantha. Although Samantha warns Maria that she is definitely not one for relationships, the two women decide to give it a go. Charlotte (Kristin Davis), meanwhile, is reveling in newfound carnal bliss with Trey (Kyle MacLachlan) in coatrooms all over town, but finds her enjoyment compromised by the lack of direction in their marriage. Miranda (Cynthia Nixon) also finds her bliss compromised when, after their first night together, her new man Doug (Jim Gaffigan) exhibits a no-holds-barred attitude toward relieving himself with the bathroom door open. Although she tries to be open-minded, Doug's laisser faire treatment of his scatological functions forces Miranda to conclude that certain things just aren't meant to be shared(n)

Meanwhile, Diaz and Santiago have trouble taking a costumed crimefighter seriously, and Holt faces a challenge to his leadership.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta is in danger of losing his flat but has no money to buy his own place, so Gina does her best to find him a new home. Holt and Jeffords organise self-evaluations for all the staff at the precinct, while Boyle helps Diaz to take revenge on one of the weekend squad officers who always makes a mess of her desk.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.sub-title: Do As I Say, Not As I Did.
programme.desc: Lennox plans to go to an all-night party with her boyfriend, and Mel is initially relaxed about the outing. However, she soon becomes anxious so Joe decides to follow the youngster and keep an eye on her. Elsewhere, Holly grows jealous when she and Ryder allow another girl into their study group. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: The duo are faced with a difficult dilemma when Joe comes into money, while a small leak in the ceiling grows into a huge problem for Mel. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Tucker arranges for Danny to take part as a guest on Mary Hart's show, but his TV appearance takes a turn when he becomes emotional during the interview. Meanwhile, Ben and Riley have a misunderstanding about Angela. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: When Riley's company is hired to represent a preacher whose life has been hit by scandal, she is charged with making sure the man's wilful daughter stays out of trouble. Meanwhile, Bonnie's new career in real estate soon hits problems. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney and Ted decide Gael's romantic successes are due to his foreign accent, and pretend to be overseas tourists to attract women. Meanwhile, Robin starts feeling stressed as soon as she returns from Argentina. Starring Neil Patrick Harris, Josh Radnor and Cobie Smulders.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin dates a single father and gets on well with his son, but soon decides that things are getting too serious and ends the relationship. Ted and Barney compete for a woman's attention to prove once and for all who is better with the ladies, while Marshall tries to show he can be a good wingman.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry seeks fresh inspiration when he loses his standing as a champion athlete at school and attempts to introduce a new sport to his friends. Murray refuses to let Beverly help out at the furniture shop when sales take a nosedive, but she's convinced the latest home furnishing craze holds the answer.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: As they bond over their shared love for the movie Dirty Dancing, Beverly is thrilled when Erica suggests the film as the theme for the upcoming school dance. However, Principal Ball refuses to sanction anything with the word `dirty' in the title, threatening Erica with suspension if she persists with the idea. Barry lobbies for the dance to be based on his favourite movie Footloose, while Adam and Pops encourage Murray to learn to dance in order to make Beverly happy.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is delighted that Leonard has finally managed to find a girlfriend who meets his high standards, but his over-exuberance looks set to cause problems. Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard turns to Penny for advice when his relationship with Stephanie takes off faster than he would have liked, and he realises he is the last person to notice that she has moved in with him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted tries to make his dermatologist jealous by flirting with her receptionist Abby. However, when she develops feelings for him it throws a spanner in the works - until Barney takes her off his hands. Guest starring Britney Spears and Sarah Chalke.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney tries to discover who has been warning women not to sleep with him. He narrows the list of possible suspects down to 64 of his former flings, and conducts a hypothetical tournament to determine the most likely culprit - with Lily insisting he must personally apologise to the ones he hurt most.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad has time to kill when the arrival of the Serbian president's motorcade to Brooklyn is delayed, so Peralta launches the seventh annual Jimmy Jab Games, an eccentric series of races and contests held in the precinct building. Meanwhile, Jeffords and Holt must set up a new drug task force approved by Holt's nemesis, Madeline Wuntch.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: It's Halloween again, and this time Peralta bets Holt he can steal his treasured watch before midnight, enlisting criminal assistance to achieve his goal. Elsewhere, Gina struggles to keep up with her college course, perform a full-time job and attend dance rehearsals - leading to problems both in and out of work.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam works on a new persona that he hopes will make him seem cool on his first day at high school. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Lainey tries to set her father up with a `woman of interest' by using new video dating technology. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj discover actress Summer Glau is on their train while travelling to San Francisco. Desperate to discuss the Terminator TV series with her, the friends devise a number of plans to engage her in conversation. With Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny starts her own hair accessories business and the orders start to pile in. However, she makes the mistake of asking Sheldon to help, leading to frustration and regret. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Freddie is interviewed by the police, and Holly tells Alfie that she's going to defend Nick. Meanwhile, Marnie finds Mac in a bad way at the hospital and gives him the number for her doctor.(n)

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Rainbow deals with feelings about her own biracial identity when Andre Jr brings home a white girlfriend, while Dre needs Charlie's advice on how to relate to a colleague.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry plans major romantic gestures for Lainey on high school prom night, while Erica and Geoff try to attend the event together, but things do not go as planned.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: After getting telephone answering machines, Murray and Pop-Pop wage a message war on one another, so Erica, Barry and Pops try to reunite them at a hockey game.(n)

programme.title: Tattoo Artist of the Year
programme.sub-title: E4's Tattoo Artist of the Year.
programme.desc: Jay Hutton and Rose Hardy welcome some flamboyantly colourful customers in the shape of drag kings and queens, with tattoo requests that include a steak pasty.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre ER
programme.desc: Cases include an injured rope maker who is tied up in knots, a squeamish patient with a piercing gone wrong, and a man who had a run-in with his lawnmower.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang's preparations for Star Wars Day are interrupted by the news that Professor Proton has died. Leonard and Penny attend the funeral, where they talk about their rejected marriage proposals, but Sheldon has difficulty dealing with the death of his childhood hero - until a surprise visitor helps him cope with his grief. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with a guest appearance by Bob Newhart.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets fired from the movie, prompting her to take a serious look at her life. Raj receives advice from Sheldon after he sees Emily on a date with another man at the cinema, while Howard's mother breaks her leg. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.desc: ESPN America's own version of ESPN's biggest and most popular show. Get all the best highlights, interviews, opinions and exclusives specially tailored for ESPN America viewers(n)

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Host Tony Reali scores arguments as four well-known reporters from around the United States debate sports' hottest stories via satellite in this fast-paced talk show(n)

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: A lively sports-talk show features opinionated reporters debating topical headlines. An on-screen 'rundown' of the topics is a signature of the series, which also includes guests in and out of the studio, and responses to viewer calls and e-mail(n)

programme.title: SportsNation
programme.desc: ESPN Radio personality Colin Cowherd and Michelle Beadle host this sports talk show that's powered by the fans. The topics covered in this weekday show are chosen by fans voting on ESPN.com's SportsNation site(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.(n)

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.(n)

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.(n)

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes some of the wildlife spectacles of southern Africa, starting out in a little-explored rainforest discovered less than a decade ago by scientists who spotted it on satellite maps. There, thousands of butterflies dance for the right to mate, while on a tiny island off Mozambique, green turtles emerge from eggs and begin a hazardous journey to the water - with pied crows and hungry crabs eager to get them. Cameras also capture one of the largest gatherings of great white sharks on the planet as 30 of the predators circle around a dead whale.(n)

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the wildlife eking out an existence in and around the scorching wilderness of the Sahara Desert, where only the toughest survive. It's a constant struggle against dehydration, as zebra battle over dwindling rivers, camels search for water and tiny barn swallows navigate thousands of square miles of barren sand to find a life-saving oasis. The naked mole rat avoids the heat by living a subterranean existence, while the silver ant is able to take on the midday sun - but needs a `spacesuit' to do it.(n)

programme.title: Six Feet Under the Savannah
programme.desc: Documentary studying the East African savannah and the habits of the naked mole-rat, which lives in the harsh conditions beneath the surface of the sand and dwells in queen-oriented communities similar to insect societies. The film uses sophisticated slow motion filming techniques and a replica of the animal's habitat in a vivarium to bring the unusual creatures' world to life.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: The lives of creatures that are dangerous on land.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: A look at earthquakes and the possible causes by man-made activity, including dams, reservoirs, mines and fracking.(n)

programme.title: Why Planes Crash
programme.desc: Documentary examining the reasons behind plane crashes - whether caused by human or technical errors or malice - beginning with the story of pilot Chesley Sullenberger III, who landed his stricken passenger plane on the Hudson River in January 2009.(n)

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the story of the island in the Indian Ocean, off the southeastern coast of Africa. It has an ecosystem that has stood in isolation for millions of years, and produced an array of wildlife that cannot be found anywhere else on the planet. He begins by observing lemurs in their habitat, male red giraffe-necked weevils fighting each other, the courting rituals of chameleons, and the behaviour of spiders and fossas.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.(n)

programme.title: Nuclear Meltdown
programme.desc: With unprecedented access inside both Fukushima nuclear power plants, this documentary offers a minute-by-minute account of the crisis of March 2011, which was triggered by the Tohoku earthquake. The film contemplates why one plant sustained such damage, while the other - facing nearly identical challenges - emerged relatively unscathed. Contributors include some of the workers present during the incident.(n)

programme.title: Why Planes Crash

programme.title: Voyager: To the Final Frontier
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell tells the story of the Voyager Space Mission, which saw two unmanned spacecraft leave Earth to explore the farthest reaches of the solar system. The probes were launched in 1977, and became the first man-made objects to visit Jupiter, Saturn, Neptune and Uranus. Having travelled 11 billion miles to date, the pair now journey beyond the influence of Earth's sun, bearing a record of human civilisation in case of discovery by other species.(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Futuristic thriller about a man whose memories may not be real(n)

programme.title: The Good Son
programme.desc: Psychological thriller about a small boy who terrorises his friends and family(n)

programme.title: Delta Farce
programme.desc: When a hard-luck blue-collar worker and his two best friends are mistaken for Army Reservists by a tough-talking Army sergeant, the plane set to fly them to the front lines of Iraq mistakenly drops them in the middle of Mexico to disastrous results in a freewheeling military comedy starring Larry the Cable Guy, Bill Engvall, and D.J. Qualls. Larry (the Cable Guy) has lost his job and his woman in the short span of 24 hours. Convinced that some suds and target shooting are just the right remedies for a broken, jobless heart, Larry sets out with his next-door neighbor Bill (Engvall) and their trigger-happy pal Everett (Qualls) in order to blast off some rounds and down some brews. Their relaxing weekend soon takes an unexpected turn, however, when hard-case Army sergeant Kilgrove (Keith David) mistakes the trio as slacking Army reservists and loads them in a plane bound for Fallujah. Subsequently air-dropped over Mexico due to pilot error, the clueless, wannabe war heroes become convinced that they're actually in the Middle East and set out to save a rural village from what they assume to be an insurgent uprising. Though the thankful locals champion the noble but dimwitted trio for their heroism, the celebration is short-lived as ruthless warlord Carlos Santana (Danny Trejo) pays a personal visit to the town with a plan to confront the fearless warriors who dared to challenge his iron-fist rule(n)

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: After a successful gay lawyer is fired from his prestigious law firm due to the fact that he has AIDS, he teams up with an attorney to sue the partners for discrimination(n)

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: A cheerful oaf is called on as a last resort to care for his brother's kids in a crisis(n)

programme.title: Up in Smoke
programme.desc: When a series of mishaps result in their deportation to Mexico, Cheech and Chong unintentionally agree to smuggle a van made entirely out of marijuana across the border(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: Anarchy. In 12th-century England, a power struggle ensues between the late king's only legitimate daughter and his nephew, who has ascended the throne via a mysterious technicality. Against this backdrop, a man of God endeavors to build a glorious cathedral(n)

programme.title: First Sunday
programme.desc: Two bumbling criminals try to rob a church, but haven't reckoned on the angry parishioners(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: In this unconventional yet heartwarming family drama, an aging rocker (Meryl Streep) returns home to her estranged family after years on the road following her dreams, and must face the music as she tries to make things right with her loved ones(n)

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: After a successful gay lawyer is fired from his prestigious law firm due to the fact that he has AIDS, he teams up with an attorney to sue the partners for discrimination(n)

programme.title: Up in Smoke
programme.desc: When a series of mishaps result in their deportation to Mexico, Cheech and Chong unintentionally agree to smuggle a van made entirely out of marijuana across the border(n)

programme.title: The Good Son
programme.desc: Psychological thriller about a small boy who terrorises his friends and family(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Futuristic thriller about a man whose memories may not be real(n)

programme.title: White Noise
programme.desc: Paranormal thriller. After the mysterious death of his wife, an architect learns that she is sending cryptic messages through the 'white noise' of his television and radio signals. However, he begins receiving more sinister information indicating that his life is in danger from dark supernatural forces(n)

programme.title: The Son of No One
programme.desc: A young cop is assigned to the precinct in Queens where he grew up, and he finds his life threatened when he investigates a police cover-up involving the unsolved murders of two boys(n)

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia
programme.desc: Tired of being bullied at school and neglected at home, Jess Aarons and Leslie Burke escape into the woods, where Leslie opens Jess's mind to the amazing kingdom of Terabithia. It's a secret land where they reign supreme among the giants, ogres and other fantastical creatures they create(n)

programme.title: Signs
programme.desc: Supernatural sci-fi thriller in which a former preacher's discovery of mysterious crop circles on his farmland sets in motion a sequence of bizarre events that sees Earth threatened by extraterrestrials(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo
programme.desc: After an accident involving his pimp and an overly-aggressive dolphin, reluctant escort Deuce heads to Amsterdam. There he finds himself in danger from a mysterious gigolo killer. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
programme.desc: Low-born Edmond Dantes is betrayed by his arrogant, aristocratic friend Fernand, who steals his bride and condemns him to the hellish Château D'If prison. After 13 years of suffering, Dantes escapes, gathers a hidden fortune and begins an intricate and fiendish revenge(n)

programme.title: Rocky
programme.desc: Uplifting, Oscar-winning drama about a small-time boxer from Philadelphia who - against all odds - gets a shot at his ultimate dream, the heavyweight championship of the world. Apparently the near-penniless Sylvester Stallone resisted various offers for his script, holding out for the title role himself(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: Master Builder. A mason named Tom Builder hopes to find work repairing the damaged church at Kingsbridge, but a lack of funds at the priory proves to be quite the hindrance. And a bandit who left his thieving ways to become a monk takes in an abandoned child(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: The Italian Stallion returns for a rematch with Apollo Creed, hoping, finally, to capture the heavyweight title. This time, even his girlfriend, Adrian, gives Rocky her blessing(n)

programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone returns to the character which made him famous in this wildly successful sequel. Rocky III starts with the Italian Stallion so famous that his likeness is everywhere, including pinball machines. Fame and complacency soon cause Balboa to lose his title to young thug Clubber Lang (Mr. T), who inadvertently causes the death of Rocky's beloved trainer, Mickey (Burgess Meredith), before their first championship bout. After sinking into a depression, Balboa must regain the love and support of his family, as well as the elusive "eye of the tiger," the hungry need to beat the opponent which former foe Apollo Creed (Carl Weathers) teaches him during this film's de rigueur training sequence. In the end, Balboa faces off against Lang for a second time. "Eye of the Tiger," the theme song Stallone commissioned from the band Survivor, became a huge hit single(n)

programme.title: Rocky IV
programme.desc: Rocky packs another punch in a bout against a Soviet named Drago(n)

programme.title: Rocky V
programme.desc: Touted upon its release as the finale of the Rocky saga, this fifth entry in the long-running series of sports dramas reunites star Sylvester Stallone with John G. Avildsen, director of the Oscar-winning original. Stallone is Rocky Balboa, suffering from career-ending brain damage as a result of his punishing bout with Ivan Drago at the finale of the previous film. Upon their return to Philadelphia, Rocky and his wife, Adrian (Talia Shire), discover they are broke, their fortune squandered by an incompetent accountant. Forced to move back to their working-class neighborhood, Rocky finds that his only asset is the run-down gym willed to him by Mickey (Burgess Meredith, who appears in new flashback sequences). Resisting big money offered to him by Don King-like boxing promoter George Washington Duke (Richard Gant), Rocky becomes a trainer and finds a talented comer in Tommy Gunn (real-life boxer Tommy Morrison, nephew of John Wayne). Rocky's son (played by Stallone's real-life son Sage Stallone) feels neglected by his father, who lavishes attention on his protégé, but Tommy ultimately turns his back on his mentor to sign a more lucrative deal with Duke, leading to a street-fight showdown(n)

programme.title: Face Off
programme.desc: Action thriller in which an FBI agent agrees to have the face of a captured international terrorist grafted onto his own head in order to discover the location of an enormous bomb. The plan goes awry when the terrorist, having assumed the agent's identity, escapes and destroys all evidence of the switch in a deadly game of cat and mouse(n)

programme.title: Signs
programme.desc: Supernatural sci-fi thriller in which a former preacher's discovery of mysterious crop circles on his farmland sets in motion a sequence of bizarre events that sees Earth threatened by extraterrestrials(n)

programme.title: Face Off
programme.desc: Action thriller in which an FBI agent agrees to have the face of a captured international terrorist grafted onto his own head in order to discover the location of an enormous bomb. The plan goes awry when the terrorist, having assumed the agent's identity, escapes and destroys all evidence of the switch in a deadly game of cat and mouse(n)

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Cinematographer Ernest R. Dickerson directed and co-wrote this crime drama about a group of friends who get involved in a robbery. Bishop (Tupac Shakur), Q (Omar Epps), Raheem (Khalil Kain), and Steel (Jermaine Hopkins) are four Harlem friends who spend their days skipping school, getting in fights, and casually shoplifting. The only member of the group who has plans for the future is Q, who dreams of becoming a deejay. But one day Bishop happens to see James Cagney in White Heat and the film inspires him to buy a gun. His plan is to rob a corner store and split the money. Everyone goes along with the plan except for Q, who is competing that night in a deejay contest. At the club, Q is a rousing success, but he spies the stern faces of his friends through the cheering crowd and realizes that he has to go along with the robbery, which goes completely wrong(n)

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: Sophisticated special effects abound in this sci-fi thriller about a spacecraft that fell off the map---only to reappear seven years later. A rescue team headed by Captain Miller (Laurence Fishburne) is dispatched to search for survivors, but finds only abandoned corridors... until horrifying visions lead them to the truth behind what happened to the ship's crew. Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: Steel. Randy Stern (Mary-Margaret Humes) hires the A-Team to help her uncle Mickey (Norman Alden), the owner of a small construction firm. A group of mobsters is determined to sabotage Mickey to prevent his excavation of some rather incriminating evidence--namely, the murdered body of his former partner. Inasmuch as this episode begins at the Universal studios where A-Team leader Hannibal is doing stunt work for a horror picture (dressed as the Creature from the Black Lagoon), expect a number of cute movie in-jokes, ranging from the name of the head villain (Carl Denham!) to a chance meeting between series regular Dirk Benedict and one of his former "co-stars" from Battlestar Gallactica(n)

programme.title: Tank Girl
programme.desc: Living in extreme conditions outside the realm of Water and Power, Tank Girl and her side kick Jet Girl are attacked and taken prisoner by the evil overlord(n)

programme.title: Played
programme.desc: After taking the fall for a heist gone wrong, a thief (Mick Rossi) gets out of prison and returns to the streets of London looking to settle the score. Val Kilmer and Gabriel Byrne costar in this gritty and action-packed crime thriller. Vinnie Jones, Patrick Bergin. Directed by Sean Stanek(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: Mel Brooks offers his irreverent and rollicking take on Star Wars and other sci-fi epics in this goofy comedy. The story features such characters as the princess Vespa, her nemesis Dark Helmet, and her hero Lone Starr(n)

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Cinematographer Ernest R. Dickerson directed and co-wrote this crime drama about a group of friends who get involved in a robbery. Bishop (Tupac Shakur), Q (Omar Epps), Raheem (Khalil Kain), and Steel (Jermaine Hopkins) are four Harlem friends who spend their days skipping school, getting in fights, and casually shoplifting.
