Season 3 begins three years after the Guilty Remnant descended on Miracle, Texas, where Kevin is now chief of police, a job that isn't made any easier by the fact that the seventh anniversary of the Sudden Departure is two weeks away, and many citizens are convinced that another apocalyptic event is in the offing(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry(n)

programme.desc: Latching. Hannah embarks on a new chapter in the series finale(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Omaha. In the Season 6 premiere, Selina tries to secure her legacy one year after losing the presidency. Meanwhile, Dan tries to fit in at his new job; and Amy's D.C.-style campaign tactics are a little too rough for her new coworkers(n)

programme.title: J. Cole: 4 Your Eyez Only, A Dreamville Film
programme.desc: A showcase for songs from hip-hop artist J. Cole's fourth studio album, "4 Your Eyez Only," features music performances and stories of hardship from residents in Baton Rouge, Atlanta, Ferguson, Mo., Fayetteville, N.C., and Jonesboro, Ark(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: The X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) in this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s. Eager to take over the world and remake it in his own image, Apocalypse recruits mutants to act as his powerful "Four Horsemen" -- among them is the tortured Magneto (Michael Fassbender), who believes humanity might be a lost cause after a personal tragedy. In time, Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and his charges must work together to save the planet from this threat. New additions to this X-Men team include the elusive Nightcrawler (Kodi Smit-McPhee), fiery Cyclops (Tye Sheridan), and telepathically gifted Jean Grey (Sophie Turner). Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, and Olivia Munn co-star(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Leaks in an underground lab cause slaughter when the lab's defence mechanisms turn the researchers into zombies. Commandos are sent in to shut the place down, but discover only cannibals driven by their hunger for human flesh(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Successful and single businesswoman Kate Holbrook is finally determined to have a kid on her own now that she is 37. But when she discovers that she has only a million-to-one chance of getting pregnant, the driven Kate finds in working girl Angie Ostrowiski an unlikely surrogate. Everything is apparently going well. That until Angie shows up at Kate doorstep with no place to live. The two opposites try to get along and, in the middle of their tug-of-war, they discover that there can be a different kind of family(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Colin Firth stars in this biopic of famous literary editor Max Perkins, which centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels and begins to alienate his lover Aline Bernstein (Nicole Kidman), Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s. Laura Linney, Guy Pearce, and Dominic West co-star in director Michael Grandage's debut feature film(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.desc: The New Cup. Bret's impulsive purchase of a new teacup sets off a string disastrous consequences that could jeopardize the future of the band, and causes Jemaine to seek extreme methods of earning income(n)

programme.title: The Conspirator
programme.desc: Lawyer Frederick Aiken defends Mary Surratt from charges of participating in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln, and realises that she's being used as bait to capture her son, the only conspirator to have eluded justice(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Drama starring Queen Latifah and Dakota Fanning, set in South Carolina during the turbulent struggle for civil rights in the early 60s. Fourteen-year-old Lily Owens is seeking to escape the clutches of her abusive father and find some relief from the haunting memories of her mother's death. In her attempt to find peace, she flees to the comforting, supportive, empowering environment created by August Boatwright and her sisters, May, and June. There, she finds a sense of purpose in looking after the sisters' bees, romance with local boy Zach and a fuller understanding of her mother's past(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: Beginning in the 1930's, The English Patient tells the story of Count Almásy who is a Hungarian map maker employed by the Royal Geographical Society to chart the vast expanses of the Sahara Desert along with several other prominent explorers. As World War II unfolds, Almásy enters into a world of love, betrayal, and politics that is later revealed in a series of flashbacks while Almásy is on his death bed after being horribly burned in a plane crash(n)

Looking to stay out of Debo's way, Craig decides that it would be a good time to visit his cousin (Mike Epps) and uncle (Don "DC" Curry), who have recently won the lottery and moved into a spacious new home in the suburbs. Like Friday, Next Friday was written by Ice Cube and his frequent musical collaborator DJ Pooh; music video director Steve Carr made his feature debut with this film(n)

programme.title: Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas
programme.desc: The Grinch, a foul-tempered green and hairy creature who lives on Mount Crumpit, hates Christmas almost as much as he hates the residents of Whoville, the town at the bottom of his mountain. One night he decides to steal Christmas away from the Whos by taking all their decorations, presents and Christmassy things. However, he soon learns a valuable lesson about the true spirit of the festive season. An adaptation of the 'How The Grinch Stole Christmas' by Dr. Seuss(n)

programme.title: Monsters vs. Aliens
programme.desc: Rainn Wilson, Hugh Laurie and Reese Witherspoon lend their voices to this high-energy, family-friendly animated movie following a team of wacky monsters who must stop an alien invasion. When alien leader Gallaxhar threatens to take over Earth, the government unleashes the only forces capable of stopping him. Mankind's hope rests with Ginormica, a 49-foot-tall woman; mad scientist Dr. Cockroach; and B.O.B., an indestructible gelatinous blob(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Writer and director Robert Rodriguez returns to the family-friendly adventure of his Spy Kids movies with this three-dimensional action opus. Max (Cayden Boyd) is a ten-year-old boy who doesn't get along with his peers and is constantly bullied at school. But Max has an active imagination, and he has a pair of very special imaginary playmates -- Shark Boy (Taylor Lautner), a human-shark half-breed cared for by a pack of great whites, and Lava Girl (Taylor Dooley), a girl with superpowers who can conjure heat and fire at will. Max may be a creative boy, but what he doesn't know is that Shark Boy and Lava Girl really do exist, and he is recruited to help them as they do battle against Mr. Electricity, a super-villain determined to deprive children of their sleep. Shot and originally released in the 3-D format, The Adventures of Shark Boy and Lava Girl also stars David Arquette and Kristin Davis as Max's parents, and George Lopez as a schoolteacher; writer and director Rodriguez wrote the film's story in collaboration with his then seven-year-old son, Racer Rodriguez(n)

programme.title: Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas
programme.desc: The Grinch, a foul-tempered green and hairy creature who lives on Mount Crumpit, hates Christmas almost as much as he hates the residents of Whoville, the town at the bottom of his mountain. programme.title: The Last Mimzy
programme.desc: An intergalactic package discovered on the beach holds a myriad of fantastic discoveries for siblings Noah and Emma Wilder in The Last Mimzy, studio head-turned-director Bob Shaye's wondrous sci-fi fantasy parable. The children stumble onto their discovery amid a trip to the family beach house, and find inside of the crate strange crystals that Emma levitates with her mind, as well as the Mimzy -- a stuffed bunny with a built-in supercomputer that advances its possessor's brain by great leaps and bounds by whispering into the person's ear. Meanwhile, via interaction with the box and its contents, Noah gains the ability to converse with spiders and instructs them to build miniature bridges. He also etches complex Tibetan mandalas, and somehow manages to black out half of Seattle. The children naturally keep these happenings (and the box) from their mom and dad (Joely Richardson and Timothy Hutton), but in time the kids set their sights higher and embark on correcting huge problems that cannot be missed. Rainn Wilson (The Office) co-stars as the children's hippie science teacher; New Age expert Bruce Joel Rubin (Ghost, Jacob's Ladder) and Toby Emmerich co-authored the script, adapting the 1943 short story Mimsy Were the Borogoves, by Lewis Padgett(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: A Philadelphia newspaper columnist and his wife move to Florida and adopt a precocious Labrador puppy that quickly turns their lives upside down(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2002 musical (itself an adaptation of John Waters' 1988 original movie) stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's (Blonsky) regular cultural highlight is a local television music-and-dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer (Michelle Pfeiffer). But could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle (Latifah), host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show? Also starring John Travolta (in drag and a fat-suit) as Tracy's mum, Christopher Walken as her dad, Amanda Bynes, James Marsden, Brittany Snow, Zac Efron and Elijah Kelley; plus cameos from the star of the original movie, Ricki Lake, and its director, John Waters(n)

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa
programme.desc: Hopelessly stranded on the remote shores of Madagascar, the New Yorkers hatch a plan to get back to Central Park that instead finds them soaking up sun in the picturesque plains of Africa. Madagascar may be a nice place to visit, but for the gang of animals who spent most of their lives in New York, there is truly no place like home. After discovering the remnants of a crashed airplane, the penguins quickly set about making the repairs needed to get the craft airborne again. When the plane finally takes to the sky, it begins to look like it's only a matter of time before Alex the Lion (voice of Ben Stiller) and friends are soaring over New York Harbor. Unfortunately the penguins weren't the aviation experts they claimed to be, and before long the crew is coming in for a crash-landing in the untamed plains of Africa. Now, as the animals reared in the safety of the zoo come into contact with their decidedly wild counterparts for the very first time, they get a better feel for their roots while marveling over the differences between life in the concrete jungle and life on the world's second largest continent. Of course, while there's plenty to love about wandering the open plains, romantic rivalries and the risk of running into dangerous poachers soon begin to outweigh the joys of some long-overdue family reunions. With some particularly heavy cases of homesickness causing hearts to weigh heavy, the group gradually starts to wonder whether they'll ever find their way back home. Chris Rock, David Schwimmer, Jada Pinkett Smith, Sacha Baron Cohen, Cedric the Entertainer, and Andy Richter lend their voices to this animated sequel that re-teams original Madagascar co-directors Eric Darnell and Tom McGrath(n)

Now, as the animals reared in the safety of the zoo come into contact with their decidedly wild counterparts for the very first time, they get a better feel for their roots while marveling over the differences between life in the concrete jungle and life on the world's second largest continent. Of course, while there's plenty to love about wandering the open plains, romantic rivalries and the risk of running into dangerous poachers soon begin to outweigh the joys of some long-overdue family reunions. With some particularly heavy cases of homesickness causing hearts to weigh heavy, the group gradually starts to wonder whether they'll ever find their way back home. Chris Rock, David Schwimmer, Jada Pinkett Smith, Sacha Baron Cohen, Cedric the Entertainer, and Andy Richter lend their voices to this animated sequel that re-teams original Madagascar co-directors Eric Darnell and Tom McGrath(n)

programme.desc: Agent 47 (Rupert Friend), known only by the barcode tattoo on his neck, is an elite international assassin. Engineered to be an unstoppable killing machine, 47 is contracted by a covert organization to assassinate high-profile targets on a global scale. He's given the assignment to kill the leader of a crime syndicate who wishes to unlock the secrets behind 47's powers and harness that information into an army of highly skilled hit men. As 47 races to complete his mission, new information emerges about his origins and sparks a race against time as the agent is hunted for the secrets behind his skills. Casey Ryback used to be a Navy SEAL, but he left it all behind and opted for a quieter life in catering. However, when he accompanies his niece on a cross-country train trip Ryback little suspects that he is about to be plunged into another life-or-death situation. The train is about to be taken over by Travis Dane, a psychopathic criminal who needs it to help him gain control of a high-tech satellite which could create havoc on Earth if it fell into the wrong hands. Ryback is on the scene - but can he do anything to stop Dane before it is too late?(n)

As the wave of self-destruction spreads, people do their best to escape whatever it is that's causing it. Among them are Philadelphia science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) and his wife Alma (Zooey Deschanel), along with Mark's friend Julian (John Leguizamo) and his daughter Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez). Their initial plans to flee to the state capital don't work out, so they take off to the countryside, where they think they'll be safe. But it's not long before they discover that they may have made a bad choice..(n)

Focusing on the early part of Hughes' adult life, the film chronicles how he built his fortune, beginning as the proprietor of his late father's tool company, then as a Hollywood producer and the owner of RKO studios, and later as an aviation mogul. Alan Alda, Alec Baldwin, and Kate Beckinsale also star(n)

programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: In Tarsem Singh's psychological thriller, Jennifer Lopez plays a child psychiatrist who is part of a team that has developed a drug-induced method to literally get inside disturbed children's minds to help them. Then FBI agent Vince Vaughn asks for her help - serial killer Vincent D'Onofrio is in custody but in a coma and unless she can unlock the secrets of his mind, an imprisoned girl will be his next victim in hours. Using visual techniques ranging from sci-fi influences to Bosch, Singh's audacious film is a stunning, chilling tour-de-force(n)

programme.desc: Western drama about notorious train robber Jesse James, who welcomes a new gang member, unaware that Bob Ford is planning to kill him(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Spike Lee and his siblings Cinque Lee and Joie Lee co-wrote this nostalgic but unglamorized look at a family growing up in Brooklyn in the 1970s, inspired by their own childhood. Woody Carmichael (Delroy Lindo) is a jazz musician whose career is in a slump; he once made a good living as a session musician, but he has moved away from it to devote himself to more serious music, a choice that has not worked out well from a financial standpoint. His wife Carolyn (Alfre Woodard) works as a school teacher to keep food on the table. The Carmichaels have five children, a bright and introspective daughter named Troy (Zelda Harris) and four sons with a habit of causing trouble, and they all share an apartment in a brownstone in Brooklyn. Crooklyn follows the Carmichaels as the kids learn the funny and painful lessons of growing up, Mom and Dad balance their love for each other against the financial and personal difficulties of the creative life, and they all try to get along with the often eccentric neighbors on their block. Crooklyn's soundtrack is enlivened by classic 70s R&B hits, including selections by Sly and the Family Stone, The Jackson Five, Curtis Mayfield, The Staple Singers, and The Chambers Brothers(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Straight Outta Compton'
programme.desc: A look at "Straight Outta Compton," a 2015 drama that chronicles the history of the hip-hop group NWA in 1980s California. The film stars Jason Mitchell, Corey Hawkins, O'Shea Jackson Jr., Aldis Hodge and Neil Brown Jr., and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend

programme.title: Clockers

At another level it follows Harvey Keitel as the world-weary cop who stubbornly refuses to believe that Mekhi Phifer is the killer of a restaurant owner who banned drug dealing. However, the film's overall impact is that of a society were survival means climbing out by any means possible and where the law is there to contain lawlessness rather than maintain law-and-order(n)

programme.title: A Serious Man
programme.desc: Black comedy set in late-sixties Minneapolis, where a physics professor's middle class life is about to fall apart spectacularly, challenging his faith in any orderly universe or attentive deity. After discovering his wife is leaving him for one of his pompous colleagues, he is forced to move into a motel with his brother. The misery continues when lecturer Larry is then wrongly accused of accepting a bribe from a student. As his life unravels before his eyes, he turns to his local rabbis for some spiritual guidance(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Drama starring Queen Latifah and Dakota Fanning, set in South Carolina during the turbulent struggle for civil rights in the early 60s. Fourteen-year-old Lily Owens is seeking to escape the clutches of her abusive father and find some relief from the haunting memories of her mother's death. In her attempt to find peace, she flees to the comforting, supportive, empowering environment created by August Boatwright and her sisters, May, and June. There, she finds a sense of purpose in looking after the sisters' bees, romance with local boy Zach and a fuller understanding of her mother's past(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason

Superstar Hugh Grant also returns as Bridget's wild playboy boss. Just when you thought the hilarious romantic entanglements were over! programme.title: Bad Boys
programme.desc: From top producers Don Simpson and Jerry Bruckheimer comes Bad Boys, with Academy Award nominee Will Smith and Martin Lawrence as Miami cops who must find $100 million in stolen heroin before their department is shut down. With time running out, detectives Burnett (Lawrence) and Lowrey (Smith) track a master thief into the Miami underworld, dodging bullets and bad guys along the way. A sexy witness (Tea Leoni) can identify the suspect, but a mix-up causes her to believe Burnett is Lowrey, forcing the partners to switch identities. Now, between shoot-outs and car chases, married man Burnett has to stick close to their only witness, while playboy Lowrey goes home to his partner's wife and kids to learn the joys of parenthood . . . The hard way. Starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence & Tea Leoni(n)

programme.title: Final Destination 3
programme.desc: James Wong, who directed the first film in the horror franchise, returned for this sequel. Mary Elizabeth Winstead plays Wendy Christensen, who has a premonition that the roller coaster she and her school friends are on is going to crash. Sure enough, after they've disembarked, there is a spectacular, satisfyingly gory crash. But once again, Death will not be cheated of his due and as the survivors succumb one by one in suitably ingenious ways (the tanning salon incident is particularly worth catching), Wendy and her friend Kevin Fischer try to work out who is next and how they'll escape(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers 2
programme.desc: Victor Salva's clever direction guides this frightening thriller about a gruesome reptilian creature that preys on humans every 23 years for 23 days. This time, it is trained on a busload of high-school athletes, who are traveling on a remote highway(n)

programme.title: Final Destination 2
programme.desc: Death is back and he wants more victims in this follow-up to the teen horror hit Final Destination . Clear Rivers (Ali Larter), the only survivor of the original cull, is recruited by Kimberley Corman (A J Cook) to stop Death's second campaign. Corman foresaw a highway pileup but those she saved are now marked. Can the pair, with the help of Officer Burke (Michael Landes) and the knowledge of the sage William Bludworth (Tony Todd), save those marked for death? Directed by David R Ellis(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Agenda for Murder
programme.desc: A crooked lawyer hopes to start a promising political career, but a former client he saved from prison threatens to blow the whistle on him. The attorney murders the blackmailer and makes it look like suicide - but the shabby sleuth sees through his ruse and sets out to expose the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Louis Zorich and Patrick McGoohan, who also directed.(n)

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: New series. Cookery competition hosted by Fern Britton in which nine contestants battle it out daily in a series of challenges for a £1,000 cash prize, with a different professional chef presiding over the kitchen each week. In the first edition, Gordon Ramsay sets the contenders their tasks in the three rounds, demonstrating how two of them should be done.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Shaun, Sam, Jackie and Gayle pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Comedian Harry Hill puts his own spin on viewers' clips. Tonight, the Mafia moves to the Lake District and Harry challenges Vic Reeves to a game of walnut golf. Plus, another pointless video in 10 Seconds of Your Life That You'll Never Get Back.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rhona and Vanessa continue to argue about work, and Pierce tries to hurry his fiancee's departure along by suggesting she take a job in Scotland. Finn asks Rebecca to invest in the taxi business, but Ross refuses to accept her help. Cain is furious at Harriet for betraying him and leaving him to spend a night behind bars.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Shona is shocked to learn David's secret and Gail begs her not to repeat what she heard, insisting he never meant to hurt Anna, while Michelle and Leanne face off at the Bistro. Rosie and Sophie use the address they found at the Gazette office as they aim to track down Sally's online troll and Faye secretly phones Phelan.(n)

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall Cops
programme.desc: Sgt Colin Taylor swaps his old life on the Isles of Scilly for a new start in the city, while the newest batch of recruits are put through their paces and officers get hot under the collar when temperatures soar in Ilfracombe. Neil Morrissey narrates.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail and Shona have a heart to heart, leaving Gail stunned, while Luke lets slip to Adam that he was not with Tracy on the night of Ken's assault. Rosie and Sophie approach Leah and accuse her of harassing Sally, and Kevin attempts to reassure Tyrone that he never set fire to the garage.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town reaches a conclusion after a multitude of twist and turns, countless red herrings and numerous suspects with shaky alibis. In the last-ever episode the truth is finally revealed as detectives Alec Hardy and Ellie Miller finally untangle the web of deceit surrounding the rape of Trish Winterman. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Nightly Show
programme.sub-title: The Nightly Show with Dermot O'Leary.
programme.desc: The X Factor presenter takes over the hot seat once more to host another five shows this week, introducing a lively mix of topical monologues, studio games, celebrity guests, stand-up and video clips.(n)

programme.title: Tales from the Coast with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor travels to the wild and remote coastline of the Outer Hebrides and discovers how an unpredictable climate has given these islands an identity and way of life of their own. At the ancient village of Gearrannan, Robson tries his hand at weaving Harris Tweed in a traditional crofter's blackhouse, with mixed results, and on the Isle of Lewis he goes snorkelling for sugar kelp, used to flavour the local gin. He also camps on the beach at Luskentyre, and on the Isle of Barra helps out at the airport, where the beach doubles as its only runway.(n)

programme.desc: Griff Rhys Jones presents this compilation of TV out-takes, on-camera clangers and rib-tickling bloopers from the programme's history. They include long-forgotten clips from the early days of the show featuring some of the biggest small-screen stars of the time, including Morecambe and Wise, Kenny Everett, Frankie Howerd and Dick Emery. Other highlights include the classic clip of a dog sliding down a hillside on its bottom and a small-screen favourite - Richard Whiteley's painful confrontation with a playful ferret.(n)

He and his trusty associates LaPointe and Janvier go in search of the caller, which leads them to the discovery of a body that has been dumped out of a car. programme.desc: A New Jersey woman disappears without a trace, so police trail her husband and search for a box containing incriminating evidence against him.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 51-year-old park ranger James Morgenson, who vanished while on duty in July 1996. His remains were found nearly five years later when it was surmised he had fallen through a snow drift, dying of associated injuries and hypothermia. His remains were washed down a creek and into a small cascade where they remained hidden for some time.(n)

programme.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: The estate of LaTanya Haggerty, a woman who, unarmed and with no criminal record, was shot dead by Chicago police in 1999. A wrangle ensued between her half-sister and other members of the family over the division of the $18million compensation payout.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Patricia Kimmi, who disappeared from her home in Horton, Kansas, in November 2009. programme.title: Rumor Has It
programme.desc: Director Rob Reiner's romantic comedy Rumor Has It stars Jennifer Aniston as a happily engaged woman. As she and her intended (Mark Ruffalo) arrive at her parents home for a wedding, she learns that her grandmother (Shirley MacLaine) and her mother once shared a lover. She realizes that her family was the basis for the book and film The Graduate, and the situation grows more complicated when Beau (Kevin Costner), the person who as a young man engaged in the affairs, beds the bride-to-be as well. Rob Reiner took over directorial duties on the film after the original director, Ted Griffin, was fired during production(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits a green bean plantation in Kenya to find out how they grow the beans so straight for the supermarkets, and finds out what happens to those that don't make the grade. At a Norwegian scallop farm, Matt Tebbutt braves the icy waters of the North Sea to join the divers harvesting scallops by hand from the seabed, and Kate Quilton tries to unravel a mystery about Cornwall's most famous local delicacy.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman meets Peter and Karen Williams from Shropshire, who fell in love with Portugal's eastern Algarve 12 years ago and now want to relocate there permanently. Jasmine finds them five homes suited to their £150,000 budget, including a property reduced by £50,000, and a house that feels just like their place back in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Natasha Conti hosts the first dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and puts together an evening on the theme of a summer fete, complete with prizes for her fellow competitors. However, as the guests get to know each other, Chris Hiller finds himself in an awkward situation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farm manager Sophie McConnell hopes that her pig-racing entertainment will impress the guests on her night as host in Salisbury, Wiltshire. She also plans to serve her home-raised cow Levi for the main course.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Anthony Brown-Hovelt hosts the third dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and his menu includes Uzbekistani food and porridge ice-cream. The former army major dresses as an American sailor, but Natasha Conti does not find the outfit as appealing as she had hoped.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housing support officer Chris Hiller plans an eclectic but affordable menu for his night in Salisbury, Wiltshire, including chicken a l'orange and peppers stuffed with baked beans. However, with the sole focus being on keeping costs low, his efforts might not go down well with the other guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Care worker Jane Arnold hosts the final dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, hoping to impress her guests with food from her local area. However, it is her bedroom revelations that catch the diners' attentions, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Anglesey, where best pals Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch hope to show that Blackthorn Farm B&B, which they own, is better than any of their guests' establishments. However, they find that their close friendship is scrutinised even more than their property.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The White Swan Hotel in Yeadon, West Yorkshire, is the second stop of the competition, and owners Graham and Barbara Yellow hope their basic facilities and affordable prices will please their guests. Spiritual couple Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor get good vibes from their room, Rachel Lonergan views the hosts in a new light and breakfast is well received by the contestants, despite having to pay a supplement fee.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Vegetarians Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor host at the Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset, and both come under attack at dinner when Malcolm voices his opinions on meat eating. In the morning, a meditation session gets a mixed response, and most of the guests are left cold by the vegetarian buffet breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Rachel and Dan Lonergan welcome their guests to the Brighton Inn, East Sussex, where they hope to offer a luxury, boutique experience. Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor give their room a thorough inspection, before the groups learns the art of building a human pyramid in the afternoon's activity. At breakfast, they discover a lack of vegetarian alternatives, and the hosts suspect game-playing when they are shocked by some negative feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their rivals and find out how much they have been paid. Richard and Susan are keen to tackle the bathroom issues of Barbara and Graham, who bask in the comments from Malcolm and Fiona. The Old Mill House proprietors defend their vegetarian breakfast routine, but serve up snobby feedback to Rachel and Dan from the Brighton Inn.(n)

programme.title: Sunshine on Leith
programme.desc: Two soldiers return home to the Scottish port town after finishing their tour of duty in Afghanistan. While they struggle to adjust to life as civilians, the parents of one of the squaddies prepare to celebrate their 30th anniversary in style. Musical featuring songs by the Proclaimers, starring George MacKay, Kevin Guthrie, Peter Mullan and Jane Horrocks.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: New series. A 21-year-old cat needs to have a huge mass removed from its ear, but any general anaesthetic at this age is a big risk, while Scott Miller is concerned about the liver of a Chihuahua suffering from diabetes.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow Chester Zoo's four new fledgling Humboldt penguins who are being brought up apart from the main colony until they're old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. They're keen to make a break for it and join the adults, but when they're finally free to go they have other ideas. Elsewhere, Niall the chimpanzee keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years. When the ape captures a moorhen chick, Niall must use his powers of persuasion to negotiate the safe release of his hostage.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Denise and Bruno Del Tufo in Ashford, Kent, who hoped to transform a concrete water tower designed by Edwin Lutyens into a contemporary home. Kevin was originally far from enthusiastic about their project, believing the original building to be ugly and brutal in its design - but the couple soon had other problems to worry about, as rising steel prices forced them to make drastic changes to their budget.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: A five-month-old puppy needs emergency surgery after a freak accident, while Scott Miller tries to find out why a poodle cross is losing the use of its legs.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick carries out delicate surgery on a Rottweiler cross, whose spinal cord is being squashed due to deformity of bone and discs in its neck. Andy and Maggs bring in their Doberman cross, Maori, with a badly bulging disc in her neck. The family has been advised to put Maori to sleep and have come to see Noel in the hope of an alternative solution. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-two-year-old retired firefighter John is airlifted to A&E after being accidentally hit in the face with a golf club, which hit him so hard that it snapped. With a suspected critical head injury, he is sent for a CT scan, and doctors are concerned that his right eye is not reacting as it should and he is weak down the right-hand side of his body. Meanwhile, 77-year-old Joan arrives in St George's after falling down the stairs at home and hurting her leg. As she waits to be treated, she talks about growing up in Camberwell.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Los Angeles to help La Frite, an outdated French restaurant that is failing to make any profits. His first step is to try to reconcile the feuding family members who run the business, and so devises a plan to bring them together by using secret filming.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: A five-month-old puppy needs emergency surgery after a freak accident, while Scott Miller tries to find out why a poodle cross is losing the use of its legs.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-two-year-old retired firefighter John is airlifted to A&E after being accidentally hit in the face with a golf club, which hit him so hard that it snapped. With a suspected critical head injury, he is sent for a CT scan, and doctors are concerned that his right eye is not reacting as it should and he is weak down the right-hand side of his body. Meanwhile, 77-year-old Joan arrives in St George's after falling down the stairs at home and hurting her leg. As she waits to be treated, she talks about growing up in Camberwell.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: An extended edition of the comedy panel show. Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Helen Flanagan, Henning Wehn, Miles Jupp and Alex Brooker to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today. Jimmy Carr hosts.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton offers advice to Liverpool couple John and Wendy Houghton, who have been married for 43 years and have long dreamt of owning a holiday home around the Spanish coastal town of Torrevieja on the Costa Blanca. The property expert leaves no stone unturned in showing the pair how far their budget of £50,000 will stretch, with the couple viewing a two-bedroom apartment with scenic vistas and a ground-floor apartment located by a picture-perfect square.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Having decided the time is right, Ann and Chris Goodwin from Leicestershire are looking to buy a Spanish holiday property in the hills west of Malaga, an area they have been visiting for some years. Jasmine Harman shows the couple five countryside retreats in line with their budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Charing, Kent, where landlady Natalie Palmer hopes to show that her B&B, The Oak, is better than any of her guests' establishments. Everything starts off well when a couple are delighted to have enough room for their yoga mats, but the rest of the party are unimpressed with the extractor fans.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the White Lady in Worstead, Norfolk, on their second night, where proprietor Dennis Gilligan tells his guests about a spooky presence that resides there. The guests get competitive in a round of clay shooting, and debate whether they believe in the existence of ghosts.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Cranleigh House B&B in Combe Martin, Devon, where former couple Katherine Armitage and Stewart Johnston offer alternative accommodation for those who enjoy yoga and are seeking spiritual enlightenment. They hope the group will send out energy for world peace and healing, but Mike and Denise question whether the whole thing is a joke.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike and Denise Mitchell welcome the contestants to Beaches B&B in Paignton, Devon, which only opened for business a few weeks ago. Fellow competitor Katherine puts the owners through their paces at breakfast when she asks for something off the menu, and the hosts are pleasantly surprised at feedback time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together for one last time to discover what they have been paid, and the identity of the winner. The Oak owner Natalie wants to know why some of her guests were not enthused by her extractor fans, but she herself receives aggression from Dennis over her criticism of the White Lady. Katherine and Stuart defend their vegetarian breakfast, and Mike and Denise deal with negative comments about their cereal selection.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his team head to an army training ground on Salisbury Plain to discover what lies beneath the Barrow Clump, a huge mound of earth built by Bronze Age people to bury their dead. More than 2,500 years later, the Anglo-Saxons re-used the location as a burial site, leaving behind some fascinating artefacts. The team is joined for the dig by a group of wounded soldiers whose members are being trained in archaeology as part of their rehabilitation.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to the Lake District to look for copper, a forgotten piece of the nation's industrial heritage. There are nearly two dozen old mines across the mountains, some thought to have been established 400 years ago when the valleys would have been studded with workshops, scaffolding and water-powered machines, home to a brave band of Tudor miners. The team battles the rain, wind and dangerously unstable trackways, but the combination of sheer effort and hi-tech kit enables the experts to access the heart of an old mine.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend face a race against time to restore a 1980s Porsche 911 from East Anglia that has seen better days - as well as suffering from almost terminal rust, the vehicle is also collapsing in on itself.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend travel to Cornwall in a bid to restore a run-down Triumph Herald that has been housed in a garage for five years.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Charismatic Australian vet Dr Scott Miller attends to the needs of more animals in his surgery in south-west London. A beagle puppy that has been left with a punctured eyeball and sliced lens seeks treatment, while vet Jo and nurse Gemma take a pregnant stray cat to foster carer Penny.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: With numbers in the wild dwindling rapidly, Chester Zoo's black rhino breeding programme is a key part of preserving the species. In this episode, black rhino Kitani is introduced to new mate Magadi, but with injury a high risk during mating, keeper Babs is concerned that Kitani may struggle to defend herself, since she lost her horn after the death of her calf. Meanwhile, there's a surprise birth in the orangutan house, and older sibling Tuti has to fend for herself and set out on the road to independence.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Charting the building plans of Peter and Christine Benjamin, who are hoping to construct a small retirement home within a walled garden in the grounds of the Edwardian manor house where they used to live. The proposed property has floor-to-ceiling glass on one side, with a traditional potting shed-style exterior on the other, but Peter's ambition to design as they build causes problems.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Med
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton explores the lesser-known side of the Costa Blanca, arriving at Moraira on one of the handful of fishing boats that operate out of the port. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Million Pound Properties
programme.desc: Twenty two-year-old Lily goes house hunting with a million-pound trust fund, and the owner of an ex-council flat in Chelsea dreams of a seven-figure sale. Plus, a B&B on the Isle of Wight, the Enchanted Manor, cannot find a buyer, despite being on the market since 2008.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: After falling over during the night at home and being rushed into A&E, 85-year-old Maura faces potentially life-changing injuries. CT scans reveal broken bones in her spine, and her son and daughter-in-law must decide when to share the gravity of the situation with Maura and her granddaughter Meg. Meanwhile, 37-year-old doctor Jim arrives at St George's after a collision with a van while he was cycling to work. Despite putting on a brave face, scans reveal his injuries are more serious than first thought. Plus, a chef is treated after cutting her thumb while chopping peppers at home.(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything
programme.desc: James Marsh's biopic of the celebrated scientist Stephen Hawking, The Theory of Everything, stars Eddie Redmayne as the famous figure. Enrolled as a graduate student at Cambridge, Hawking establishes himself as one of the leading minds of his generation, and begins to win the heart of Jane (Felicity Jones). After one of his earliest breakthroughs, Hawking is diagnosed with ALS, and he becomes less and less able to control his own body. With the loyal Jane at his side, he continues his work. However, as the years progress, Jane starts to feel more like a nurse than a wife, and Hawking begins to have feelings for a woman who is hired to care for him. The Theory of Everything screened at the 2014 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Prank Patrol
programme.desc: Barney Harwood and the mischievous ninjas help another youngster pull the wool over a friend's eyes with an elaborate hidden-camera stunt.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.sub-title: Deadly Pole to Pole: The Complete Journey: Bird Island.
programme.desc: Steve Backshall takes a four-day journey to Bird Island, a sub-Antarctic landmass home to wildlife including the wandering albatross - which has the largest wingspan of any bird - and giant petrels and skuas. The presenter also dives with fur seals in the freezing waters.(n)

programme.title: Invisible Sister
programme.desc: Premiere. A shy teenage genius's science project goes horribly wrong, and turns her popular older sister invisible. She finds herself forced to cover for her sibling's disappearance, even taking her place on the school lacrosse team, while facing a race against time to find a cure before the change is permanent. Fantasy comedy, starring Rowan Blanchard and Paris Berelc.(n)

programme.title: Scoil Bhride - Your Home
programme.desc: The winning entry in the RTÉ Factual Award category at the Fresh Film Festival, made by the pupils of Scoil Bhride Primary School in Shantalla, Co Galway.(n)

programme.title: The Great Race
programme.desc: A host of weird and wonderful characters takes part in a 22,000-mile car race from New York to Paris in the early 1900s. The candidates include a dashing hero, a dastardly villain and a suffragette looking to strike a blow for women everywhere. Blake Edwards' comedy, starring Tony Curtis, Jack Lemmon, Peter Falk and Natalie Wood.(n)

programme.title: Racing from Fairyhouse
programme.desc: Robert Hall and Ted Walsh present live coverage of day two of the Easter Festival, which includes feature race the Irish Grand National. With analysis from Andrew McNamara, Brian Gleeson, Tom Lee and Tracy Piggott, and commentary by Tony O'Hehir.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer finds himself in Marge's bad books after ruining a night out, so when a head injury keeps him off work, he decides to use the time wisely and reflect on his marriage - and as luck would have it, movie star Stradivarius Cain is on hand to offer a few pearls of marital wisdom. With the guest voice of Bryan Cranston (Breaking Bad).(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Steph organises an Easter picnic, placing Sonya under additional strain as she tries to put some distance between herself and Mark. Ben opens up to Karl and Susan.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Tori admits she is contemplating moving to the city with Riley, while Mason asks Olivia to go on a road trip and Alf is delighted that Irene seems to be bonding with her grandchild.(n)

programme.title: Lords and Ladles
programme.desc: Fred Madden's great great grandfather traversed the globe before turning his attention to the upgrading of the family home in Monaghan, which Fred's father Johnny Madden refers to as an iced-cake. Derry Clarke holds the ladle for the recreation of a hunt supper from 1908, featuring such delicacies as pudding a la Diplomate and Turkey boiled with oysters. Paul Flynn hunts for a herd of wild pigs on an island in Lough Erne with Pat O'Doherty, producer of the famous Fermanagh Black Bacon, gets a lesson in cheese-making at Corleggy Cheese in Belturbet, Co Cavan, and collects a special order of cockscombs and turkey testicles for one of Derry's less appetising recipes.(n)

programme.title: Designing Ireland
programme.desc: The impact design has on people's everyday lives, and the increasingly visible role that Irish architects and designers play in the industry. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Quantum of Solace
programme.desc: James Bond sets out on a personal mission of vengeance as he pursues the secret criminal organisation Quantum. His search leads him to the head of an ecological corporation, who is plotting to orchestrate a coup in a Latin American country to get his hands on a precious natural resource. Spy thriller sequel, starring Daniel Craig, Olga Kurylenko, Judi Dench, Gemma Arterton and Mathieu Amalric.(n)

programme.title: Soccer Republic
programme.desc: Peter Collins is joined by Declan O'Brien and John McDonnell to present highlights and analysis from the latest SSE Airtricity League fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Shortscreen
programme.desc: Graham Cantwell's short film Lily, in which a girl with a secret is faced with the greatest challenge of her young life.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: The Cannabis Smugglers: Stacey Dooley Investigates.
programme.desc: The presenter travels to Swaziland to witness how powerful strains of cannabis are being grown and smuggled into Britain. She meets the farmers harvesting the drug, the mules getting rich transporting it and the police who are trying to stop the trade, as well as learning how it is being mixed with heroin to make a highly addictive substance.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An immigrant petty officer dies in an apparent suicide, though Loretta finds fingermarks around the neck that suggest he was strangled before being thrown off a bridge. The team questions the victim's mother and brother, who both live locally and a link is found to a people-smuggling gang bringing migrants into the States using boats. When the team members intercept the latest arrivals, they see a familiar face. Elsewhere, the agents secretly create an online dating profile for Pride. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Ka Pohaku Kihi Pa'a (The Solid Cornerstone).
programme.desc: When the task force's long-time informant is accused of murder, McGarrett brings in an old friend to defend him.(n)

programme.title: Monday Mornings
programme.desc: Sung, Hooten and Villanueva join forces to convince Trisha Miller, a 13-year-old girl with an advanced brain stem glioma, to try surgery one last time before giving up. Meanwhile, shaken from losing a patient, Ty turns to Dr Tina Ridgeway for support, Tierney tries to bully resident Michelle Robidaux into pronouncing a potential organ donor brain dead, and Sydney enlists Villanueva's help in diagnosing a patient under the care of internist Dr John Lieberman.(n)

programme.title: EuroNews
programme.desc: European and international headlines live via satellite.(n)

programme.title: Wild Kratts
programme.desc: Animation for children about two brothers who use creature power suits created from animal DNA.(n)

programme.title: Storytime

programme.title: The Taste of Success

programme.title: Restoration Home
programme.desc: Caroline Quentin follows the fortunes of retired couple Peter and Anne Hills as they renovate Little Naish, a Victorian gardener's cottage in Clapton in Gordano, Somerset. The Grade II-listed gothic tower has been empty for almost a quarter of a century, the stonework is crumbling, rot is eating the wood and the plaster is beyond repair. A series of unforeseen structural issues starts to eat into the budget, but evidence emerges that the building has a far richer historic pedigree than anyone imagined.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: Thailand: Tourism and the Truth - Stacey Dooley Investigates.
programme.desc: The TV personality travels to Thailand, which attracts thousands of British holiday-makers each year, to investigate the darker side of the country's tourism industry. She gets a job as a chambermaid in Phuket, which entails cleaning 14 rooms to a high standard for £4 per day. There is also an insight into what life is like on such a low income, and the sacrifices some people have made, including living in slum conditions and being separated from their children for months at a time.(n)

programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Chippenham.
programme.desc: In Chippenham, Wiltshire, Nick Knowles is joined by designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen to build an extension for a woman whose son suffered a brain injury while playing rugby in 2009. The team recruits extra help from the local community to construct a suitable space so he can move as soon as possible to a place approved by his carers.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi comes to the rescue of more struggling hotels, beginning with a visit to Epstein House in Liverpool where owner Patrick Duggan is having problems keeping his business afloat. The property was the home of the Beatles' manager Brian Epstein and Patrick was sure the guest house would be highly profitable when he bought it, but such expectations have yet to be realised.(n)

programme.title: Inside Harley Street
programme.desc: The final programme focuses on the practitioners on Harley Street who provide complementary and alternative therapies to their clients. May Lyang has been trying to have a baby for five years and visits Dr Zhai, who offers traditional Chinese medicine for fertility, while identical twins Luba and Irena Chmil attend the clinic of kinesiologist Dr Michael Culp to fend off the exhaustion of daily life, and American financial consultant Alex Adler has intravenous vitamin infusions to maintain peak performance. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: American serial killer Bill Suff, who is thought to have murdered between 12 and 22 people during an 18-year spree. Described as a mild-mannered loner, Suff raped, stabbed, strangled, and sometimes mutilated prostitutes in California, beginning in 1986. In January 1992, he was arrested after a routine traffic stop.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Manchester.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of Manchester couple Rebecca and Steve, whose life was changed for ever when they found out they were expecting triplets. Two years on, Rebecca is becoming depressed by the state of their small, damp, dilapidated house, which is unsafe for the children. The builders have just nine days to bring the property up to date and give this tired mum and dad the space they need for their active offspring. Luckily, local tradespeople and other members of the community turn out in force to help.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A trail of blood from an abandoned car found smashed into a telegraph pole leads the police to a man who has been drinking, but Watford officers must prove he was driving the vehicle. Near Bedford there is a manhunt, with dogs and a helicopter tracking two men fleeing across fields. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.(n)

programme.title: The World's Biggest Penis
programme.desc: Documentary lifting the veil on the taboo subject of whether size matters and what it is really like to be well endowed. `Gifted' males, including one who claims to have the world's biggest penis, reveal there are in fact disadvantages to what nature has bestowed, as they describe the reality of living out many men's dream.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: The case of Charles Albright, who is suspected to have killed three women in Dallas' red light district between 1990 and 1991, and surgically removed their eyeballs.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and the team uncover evidence of a deadly slave-trading operation after a man is found drifting off the coast.(n)

programme.title: Animal House
programme.desc: Documentary series shining a spotlight on the staff at SPCA Auckland, who dedicate their days to the care and protection of the region's animals. From an injured penguin in need of first aid, to a litter of kittens trapped inside a wall, these compassionate professionals are committed to the rescue, rehabilitation, and adoption of animals in distress.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Hananya's chimps are subdued when Cherri loses one of her newborn twins. Elsewhere, a fight breaks out at the lemur enclosure when two new arrivals are given a rough welcome.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison and wildlife vet John Lewis travel to Monkey World's sister sanctuary in Vietnam to release two golden-cheeked gibbons back into the wild.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster reveals how life has learnt to adapt quickly in the ever-changing volcanic landscape, resulting in species that exist nowhere else in the world. David investigates the driving forces behind their evolution, exploring the appearance and behaviour of remarkable creatures and vegetation including giant whale sharks, marine iguanas and seemingly normal dandelion seeds that grow into plants the size of trees.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his exploration of the archipelago with a look at how, despite their proximity, no two of the 19 islands are the same. He also uncovers evidence that evolution on Galapagos is occurring faster than Charles Darwin could ever have imagined, and encounters Lonesome George, the last remaining giant Pinta Island tortoise, which died just a few weeks after filming in June 2012.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough at 90: Behind the Lens
programme.desc: A profile of broadcaster and naturalist David Attenborough, whose career has included being controller of BBC Two and making numerous groundbreaking wildlife programmes.(n)

programme.title: Flying Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the world of the pterosaur, a flying creature that occupied the skies 200 million years ago. Visiting sites around the world, from the Dorset coast to New Mexico, he explains how the reptiles evolved to defy the forces of gravity, and examines the features of their anatomy that can still be seen in present-day descendents. He also discovers why they became extinct after dominating the skies for millions of years.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural History Museum Alive
programme.desc: The broadcaster invites viewers to join him as he takes an after-hours stroll around one of his favourite places, the Natural History Museum. But this is no ordinary tour as some of the many exhibits spring to life as the veteran naturalist strolls along.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Jazz musician Bleeding Gums Murphy teaches Lisa how to express her gloomy moods through music, and inspires her to write a blues tune for him - which proves unexpectedly popular.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron's emotional sister Pam proves too much for Mitchell when she comes to visit, while Phil and Claire struggle to stay awake during a spontaneous trip to Paris. Jay's bathroom remodeling project frustrates Gloria, and Andy has a wild night out in Las Vegas with Haley.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire and Gloria leave Luke and Manny on babysitting duties while they head off to a day at a spa, while Phil and Mitch go to the movies and Jay and Cam visit a sports bar. programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge starts her own sandwich shop after her snacks become a huge hit at Springfield Elementary. However, running a business proves challenging - especially when the same franchise opens another location across the street.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist turns his attention to creatures that dominate the skies today. He begins with the vast bird family, watching a group of vultures as they go scavenging and some peregrine falcons dive bombing for their prey. He then moves on to the floating forests of Ecuador to find out what makes the humble hummingbird tick, before ending his journey at the Gomantong bat caves of Borneo - a place he first filmed in 1972 - witnessing a mass exodus of the creatures.(n)

programme.desc: Former Navy Seal Graham Rivers takes a group of tourists hostage on the USS Missouri, and McGarrett uses his own special forces training to board the vessel and talk him down. programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team is called when the charred body of a police officer is found in a fire pit. programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: An undercover operative is identified and killed by a local gang, who post the video of the murder online. programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Santos team decides to get involved with Rock the Vote during the election campaign, and mingles with a host of musical stars. Meanwhile, the Attorney General pressures Toby to reveal the truth about the shuttle leak. Jon Bon Jovi guest stars.(n)

programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: The British

programme.title: Police Academy 6: City Under Siege
programme.desc: The clueless cops return yet again, this time to thwart the machinations of a crime lord behind a wave of raids and robberies in the city. Unfortunately, they are unaware Mr Big is always one step ahead thanks to a police informer. Penultimate entry in the comedy series, starring Bubba Smith, David Graf, Michael Winslow, Matt McCoy and Leslie Easterbrook.(n)

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: Three men on a stag weekend in Las Vegas wake up after a night of heavy drinking and find they have not only misplaced the groom, but somehow gained a tiger and a baby. Unable to remember the details of the night before, they set about piecing the clues together in the hope of finding their missing friend. Comedy, starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis.(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious TV weatherman reporting on a small town's annual festival finds himself caught in a bizarre time loop, and is forced to relive the same day over and over again. While at first he tries to exploit his predicament, he is ultimately driven to mend his ways and adopt a less cynical attitude. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, Chris Elliott and Stephen Tobolowsky.(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two estranged sisters are reunited when their parents decide to sell the house they grew up in. They return to the family home to clear out their childhood bedrooms, but with their parents away, seize the chance to relive their teenage years and throw one last wild house party. Comedy, starring Amy Poehler, Tina Fey and Dianne Wiest.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours 2
programme.desc: A couple seek the aid of a former rival in fighting back against the raucous college sorority that moves in next door to them. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: Daddy's Home
programme.desc: A mild-mannered man hopes for his wife's two children to view him as their father. His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: The foul-mouthed talking teddy bear is horrified to discover that he counts as property according to the law. He and his human best friend hire a pot-smoking lawyer to help them fight a court case and get Ted legally recognised as a person. Comedy sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg and Amanda Seyfried, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)
